While the girls in the group can't understand why this place was recommended as they normally only focus on category one restaurants, all the guys said they'd be back for more. $9.99 for a 2-item bento box meal is pretty hard to find in the city, especially in a popular area like Japantown. i can definitely see how it's very enticing. Under normal conditions, I would rate Kui Shin Bo 3 stars for food quality, but the staff was extremely nice and I'll add 1 stars for the boys. 

In conclusion:  If you're female, you'll probably want your boy to take you somewhere with tastier but less cost-efficient food. If you're male, don't let your girlfriend read yelp reviews until after dinner and save some money on date night!
author: Annie Z.

description:
Food: 4
Service: 3
Place: 4

Food: We ordered Pink Lady Roll(decent), Crunchy Roll(very flavorful) and Special Dragon Roll(pretty good).

Service: The servers aren't that attentive, the cook had to draw the attention of them a couple of times.
author: Ricky C.

description:
I usually love these kinds of Japanese restaurants because there's a wide variety of selection, but not this time!  In sum on our choose two deal, we got a brown avocado roll, cold tofu and chicken and bad service on Saturday night.  

On the menu you had different kinds of noodles, rice bowls and sushi and I thought that these were reasonably priced for San Francisco.  And!  They had this choose two w/ miso, rice and salad for $10.99 deal.  Everything on the menu looked great, but my boyfriend and I ordered the choose two deal.  

For me, I got an avocado roll with agedashi tofu.  My avocado roll was brown, which I know that just because the avocado is brown doesn't mean its spoiled.  But I'm an avocado roll enthusiast.  Over the years, I've never been served a brown avocado roll.  It just looks bad.  Still tasted okay for brown avocado.  The salad was good.  The miso was good.  Then I started with the agedashi tofu.  I thought the tofu was cold because I ate everything else really slow.  But turns out, these guys just like serving cold food.  

My boyfriend ordered chicken teriyaki and a California roll.  The avocado in his California roll was green.  I'm not mad.  BUT!  He told me after we left that his chicken was cold.  And that part of his rice was cold.  I guess he didn't want me to stop him from eating it, because he still ate it.  But how are you going to be serving people cold food?  

Maybe the cold food and brown avocado roll I got was limited to the choose two deal.  For the people who ordered noodles or the rice bowl,  all of their food looked pipping hot!  

Aside from the food, we got pretty bad service on a Saturday night.  It was turning into a busy Saturday, and its a small restaurant with what seems to be two servers, one sushi maker and whoever was cooking in the back!  So while I understand that it was busy, I don't find that its an excuse for missed drinks orders and no refills on water.  

Maybe I'd come back for noodles or rice bowls, but it was a bad first impression and there's a lot of other places to choose from in Japantown.  I mean, who serves brown avocado rolls?
author: Cristina C.

description:
I wanna give them a zero. A big fat 00000!!!! No even worse, a minus 1000000!!!

Came for lunch on a Sunday. Ready?

So, I told my friend there is no where in Japantown that tastes good. She's just as picky as I am when it comes to food, prob even more than me. She said "cmon stop being so negative, it's prob not that bad, as you describe". I should have been more adamant NOT to eat in Jtown... 

Ok fine. Let's try the one and only place in Jtown that has 4 star Yelp review with 364 reviews. Can't be that bad. Can't be. 

... Ok wait for 20 min. 
They asked if I wanted hot tea or water, I said can I have both, they said they would have to charge me... Ok... I'll take tea. 
Tried to order sushi. Said it in Japanese, slowly, like the menu has it written. Waiter could not understand it. Had to say "N11, N8"... No one in here is Japanese....
"Oh and no wasabi please" I said, he said "that's ok, it comes on the side"... Came on top. Now my fish tastes like wasabi. 
The fish literally ripped every time I picked it up. It tasted like frost bite. They were all mush, and small little pieces. Maguro was also fake. I can get better sushi at Safeway, which I already don't buy. The fish was literally like 2 weeks old. I would have rather ate a tunafish sandwich that was sitting out in the sun for a day. 

Worst part was, the rice smelled like dirty sour dish towel and made me almost vomit. Not one area of rice. Alllllllllll our rice. When I would bring the food to my face to eat it, it smelled so offensive. I literally gagged and could only eat a couple bites of the rice. 

My friend ordered the sushi sashimi plate and shabu x2. The shabu x2 came in a hot pot, chunks of weird meat. Already cooked. In some sort of weird broth. I called them over (now I'm pissed and I have a lot of patients) and was like, what is this... Sent it away. You should have seen our faces. We both barely ate. 

Asked for the check. They said they took the shabu x2 off (duh!!!), but then charged us something random for $16. We told him we didn't order this. He said oops my mistake, I mispushed the button. He tried to argue the sushi when we didn't even wanna bring it up. My friend got pissed and said while pointing at me "she's Japanese from Japan!!!" They guy looked at my face and made a "nah whatever" face at me and shooed with his hand. Omg, let me throw this food at your face!!!! Plus he was talking to this other waitress in a different language in front of me? Don't wanna say it in English huh? GTFOH. 

In the end, we barely ate, spent $60 between 2 of us. And my friend got Diarrhea. 
Worst sushi in my entire life, and I am traumatized for a while now. 

I warn you. Doooooo noooooot eeeeeeat heeeeereee!!!
author: R M.

description:
It was my last night in SF before heading back home. I was exhausted and I had to be up to leave for the airport at 3am. Instead of powering through like I normally would do (go out and just not go to sleep) I decided to attempt to be responsible and opted for a night in in my hotel room with PJs and delivery. This proved to be a pretty great call thanks to Eat24 and Kui Shin Bo.

It was a Thursday night so the wait for the food was a bit significant (almost an hour and a half) but luckily I ordered before I was starving. Coming from the midwest where sushi isn't always the best I decided to try a few things and ended up with WAY more food than I needed but that's ok.

Firstly I was kind of dumb and didn't realize that the Rainbo'rrito was an actual sushi burrito. I mean the name says it all but I guess I missed the category when I was ordering on Eat24 so I just assumed it was a standard size roll. Nope, it's a burrito. And it's much larger than a roll. But it was delicious and I made sure to make a sizeable dent in it before moving onto my next roll--the Salmon Family (crispy salmon skin topped with fresh salmon, ikura, avocado, mango and cream cheese with lemon yuzu sauce) which was also a solid win. Salmon is definitely my favorite of all the raw fish options (next to the always expensive fatty tuna) so I was in heaven with this one.

Would I do it again? ABSOLUTELY. The fish is fresh, the combo of ingredients in each roll are great, and for this midwest gal it was the perfect end to a long week in SF.
author: Annette J.

description:
Stop by inside the Citibank building in Japan for some great sushi. I got to order my very first sushiritto and it was awesome. I got the one filled with tofu and the wasabi spicy mayo. Really tasty!

I also got to try the volcano sushi, which they ate known for and it was really good. 

This is all coming from someone who doesn't love sushi so take my word for it and stop by. 

The service is very fast and I thought the prices were very fair for SF.
author: Bushra H.

description:
The place is pretty tiny, lending itself to long waits if you show up at the wrong time.  I flew in solo and had a bowl of ramen at the bar.  Solid but unmemorable.  I would opt to down the street to Tanpopo the next time I find myself in a ramen bind.

Btw: they take credit cards but not AMEX.  The host was very nice to make an exception for me since I didn't have cash or another card with me.
author: Amy J.

description:
Fluctuating between a 1 and 2 star for this restaurant. I've been here a couple times now and service is pretty unorganized. The reason I would give this place another star would be because once my friend mentioned that the owner seemed enthusiastic to show him how to eat his order and the grilled fish items are rather tasty.

Here's what's not ok: I came here with 2 friends and 2 of us order things off of the mix and match $9.99 menu+ nigiri($4.25) and the other ordered a roll. The bento items came out first and that is fine because we understand things are made at different times but we repeatedly had to ask for the status of the sushi roll. It took about 40+ minutes for that sushi roll to come out and by that time the bento people were finished eating. Not ok.

The food: like I said, the grilled fish/fried fish items are yum. The salmon nigiri was poorly made and did not taste good at all. My friend waited 40 minutes for her salmon family roll that she has gotten multiple times so she knows what goes in it. When it finally arrived, my friend had eaten 1 piece and then we found it was missing the cream cheese. We told the owner and he brought over the person who made it who insisted it was inside. We had to literally open up the roll and show him he was lying. I'm personally not a fan of cream cheese in a roll but there are those who are and if you are going to list it as having it in there, then it should be as such. Instead of taking the roll back the owner wanted to bring a side of cream cheese and seemed hesitant to do anything to rectify the problem at all. Not cool. Let's remember that the 2 other people at the table have already finished eating. They finally took back the roll and we thought they would remake it but it was very obvious they just took the same roll and peeled everything off and put it back on. Even to the point that the roll was short 2 pieces. Unappealing and unappetizing.

Take a little pride in your craft please.
author: Jessica C.

description: Went back and tried something else.  Still impressed.  Again, get there early because the place gets full quick.
author: J M.

description: Good hospitality and the price is reasonable. All rolls are looking good but i had lunch set, saba shiso and fried fish(i forgot the name lol) served with rice (not a Japanese rice) miso soup and small salad.
author: Tiratiwan L.

description:
Kui Shin Bo definitely seems to win on the price war in Japantown. Bento lunch boxes are served all day for $9.49 and include your choice of 2 entree items, rice, miso soup and salad. The portions are generous, the food is fresh and the service is friendly. 

I had the Nigiri Combo (8 chef's choice pieces, $13.95) and a Deep Fried California Roll (10 pieces for only $4.99!). Looking for a tasty lunch that won't set you back? Go for the Deep Fried California Roll. It's simple, tasty and cheap! The Nigiri Combos comes with all your standard selections including tuna, salmon, shrimp, snapper, hamachi and mackerel. Our server/owner asked what type of fish I preferred for my combo plate, which I thought was a nice gesture. 

Everyone was happy with their dinner selections (Katsu Chicken Curry, Potato Croquette, Beef Teriyaki and the Fried Squid). I got a few samplings of the Fried Squid and it was a little chewy but had some good flavor and comes with a tasty dipping tempura sauce and Japanese plum sauce. The potato croquettes were a nice accompaniment with a crispy and crunchy outer layer giving way to a moist and creamy mashed potato filling. 

Head to Kui Shin Bo if you're seeking a well-priced Japanese lunch or dinner with a welcoming vibe.
author: Nicole D.

description:
We're here on a Saturday around noon and we both had the 2 item $10.99 Bento special​. It of course came with rice and Miso soup. The portion were slightly smaller than a regular Bento but for a light lunch suited us perfectly.

We shared Chicken Katsu, Saba Soiyaki, Fish Katsu and Veggie Tempura. We really enjoyed every item. The Saba came with a fresh minced radish. The older gentleman showed us the best way to eat the combo.

When we got there there were 3 couples inside. When we left the place was full and some people waiting.
author: Jimmy T.

description: Super good sushi in an unlikely food mall in Japan town.  The pricing can't be beat, each of us paid under $15.00 for a completely satisfying meal.  Good service.
author: Madaline C.

description: The food was pretty good and they had good service. I ordered the Miso Ramen expecting a nice salty miso broth but it tasted very earthy. The bamboo shoots were very overpowering the miso flavor which was disappointing. Shrimp and Vegetable Tempura was tasty though.
author: Emma A.

description: One of the best Japanese cuisine places in town. I love the tranquility and the food is amazing. Being vegetarian can be tough at times, but they have some amazing dishes like the wakame soba, veggie okonomiyaki and the avokyu roll. The owner Willie is super nice and welcoming.
author: Lisbeth H.

description:
The ramen shop is hidden in the corner of the complex in Japantown. On the outside, it may seem like an average ramen shop but once you sit down and taste the food, you quickly change your perspective.

I ordered the shrimp tempura to start and did not regret the decision. It had a crispy texture and it was fried to perfection. It also had a lot of meat. In addition, the ramen was delicious. I sampled multiple bowls of ramen, as my party ordered different items. All were delicious and more than reasonably priced. The prices do not get any better than this and you get a lot more than what you are paying for. Furthermore, this place is very generous with the portions of the meals.

I would definitely recommend giving this place a try if you are in the area or craving ramen!
author: Timothy T.

description:
This is incredibly reasonably priced Japanese food - but, honestly, I wouldn't say it was that good. We shared a sashimi plate and a ramen. I probably wouldn't get the ramen again (I found it a little bland), but the sashimi appeared pretty fresh. If I was in the area doing a little shopping and found myself in 

I highly recommend getting there a little early for dinner - we waited for a little over an hour for our table. Also, if you put your name down, do not walk away! You will be crossed off the list and you will have no second chances.
author: Sharon C.

description:
Food was clean and very tasty! 
Volcano roll was very flavorful, but I would've liked it better without the shredded imitation crab on top. But I highly recommend the spider roll! 
The beef skewers was a but too sweet and seemed over cooked. 
Service was friendly, but, because it was busy, they kinda wanted you in and out. Not really a place to sit and really chew through your food and have a conversation.
author: Sarah S.

description:
This place is super random but really good. My boyfriend and I came here and got 2 speciality rolls, both which were really good and had a good rice to fish ratio. We got the rock n roll and the baked scallop roll. We also got a sushi burrito/ the rainbow-rito, which was also really good and a lot of food. 

Overall, it was $42 for those three things which was kind of expensive, but it was good and casual/ close to my house so I would definitely come back.
author: Jenna G.

description:
The restaurant is really SLOW even though there are not that many people.

My friend and I both got their lunch bento boxes. Unfortunately, the food is really disappointing. The chicken for the teriyaki chicken dish was simply boiled and drizzled with sugary teriyaki sauce. The chicken katsu is sadly fried. The sushi rice is soggy and feels like it was left out for too long.

Service is bad. Food is bad. I don't understand why this place is so highly rated on Yelp.
author: Clare L.

description:
Honestly, i'm not sure what good I can say about this place. 

Service: 
They are really unorganized. For such a small place, there didn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to who was taking orders, cleaning, etc.
Specific to our visit, their "system" messed up and lost our order. Things happen, I get it. But to not apologize after was just rude. We ended up waiting almost an hr for two bowls of udon and a veggie tempura appetizer. Both tables closest to us that sat roughly 10-15 minutes after we sat were both served their food and were receiving their checks by the time we got our food. 

Food:
Nabeyaki Udon: Broth was bland. Tasted mostly like cabbage soup. It was "okay" but nothing to write home about.

Curry Beef Udon: normally, i've ordered this and it comes to be more of a soup, like they've added broth to a thicker curry to make it soupy. This one was the exact opposite. First, it was served on a plate, not a bowl. The curry was thickened with either corn starch, old tempura, or noodles. This gave it a very slimy texture. Add that to udon that wasn't in broth and it made for a very slimy experience. 

Tempura:
Actually, this was the only part of the meal that wasn't half bad. Kind of a small portion for 7.99, but i can't complain about the taste. 

Sadly, this place has been averaging 4 stars which might be right compared to other places at Peace Plaza, but with service this bad I don't think we'll be back.
author: Chris P.

description:
Arrived around 7p and signed in wait list.  As two people ahead of us, we waited 15 minutes to get a seat for two in the small restaurant that seats around 40. 

We had the special - two items to choose from varied list.  Comes with miso soup and salad cup. One order was beef teriyaki with shrimp tempura. Meat was tender and tempura was spot on.  Since second order choice was udon and bbq boneless pork ribs, didn't get miso or rice.  Udon was perfect! 

Dropped one star due to service.  Great price for good prepared food.
author: Robert M.

description:
Went here for dinner on a Sunday evening with my wife, we ordered their 2 item special with our choices of beef teriyaki and my wife's choice of chicken katsu. We also had a philly and their dynamite roll. All the food was excellent, the atmosphere was comfortable and the ambiance was low-key and unassuming. 
I recommend this place to anyone looking for a good, casual sushi experience while in Japan town.
author: Daniel C.

description: Tasted like supermarket sushi & super slow service , also didn't seem to be very clean
author: Silvia G.

description:
Solid service and very nice people. I'm sure the $9.99 lunch special is just fine.

But the sushi just isn't good. 

PASS.
author: Josie M.

description:
Tucked away in a corner next to Ichiban Kan is a hidden gem of a restaurant that serves fresh, tasty Japanese food in generous portions! 

We ordered: 
12 pc sashimi combo with tuna, mackerel, & yellowtail - very fresh and good sized pieces. 

Gyoza - delicious

Edamame (spiced) - loved it with a kick!

Grilled squid - delicious & cooked to perfection. 

2 item bento box from the specials board: grilled mackerel (the size of my forearm) with tempura (shrimp & veggies), rice, salad & miso soup for $9.95!!!
You can't beat this deal for the amount of food you get. 

Lastly, the service was friendly and very attentive. It's a small restaurant that serves big!

We will be back again!
author: Sam H.

description: Went for the $10 bento box special - choose two items plus miso soup, rice, and salad. Surprisingly still had a wait at 2 pm. It's not fine dining but still quite satisfying and a great price for Japantown. Got ramen and takoyaki, and hubby got ramen and veggie tempura. The waiter was nice enough to rearrange our order to ramen ramen and tempura takoyaki so we got the soup/rice/salad (since ramen doesnt come with those). Friend got chicken teriyaki and shrimp tempura and said the shrimp tempura was some of the best he's had. Left happy and full.
author: Ann C.

description:
Food is not bad. 

Huge menu selection. 

Service is slow. 

They like to dump the dish in front of you. 

Probably won't come back again.
author: Rich L.

description:
When you order tai, they will give you rockfish. When you order sake, they will give you some tough trout with dye. The hamachi is not actual yellowtail but a cheaper dish with a yellow tail. Their carpaccio, a raw dish, is cooked. If you order from the woman, the male...owner?... will not let her put in your order (for a hungry child) until he deems the order worthy. The broth for udon is hot water with pepper in it. They don't want to give your party of four more than one plate for sauce. They keep their drinks in a fridge but it isn't turned on. If you bring any of this up they will argue and lie to you. It doesn't bother them to lie because they think you're not local and they already tricked you into ordering.

This a spot to extract $ from tourists and rubes. Garbage fish. Garbage food.
author: Cyrus M.

description:
I had to pass some time with some friends in Japantown and my friend recommended we try this place. We had to wait for about 45 mins before sitting down to eat at this place because the place was full and there was a wait list. We took this as a good sign so my friends and I wandered about the mall to pass more time. After about 40 mins we were called in and excited to order!

They offer so many items on their menu. I really wanted to try their special Ramens but everyone here on Yelp recommended the lunch special because it was such a great deal so that's what I did!

I ordered the lunch special and my 2 items were Chicken Katsu and Ramen. Ramen was okay, though I wish I could have ordered the specialty ones instead. Chicken Katsu was crispy but it was not delicious. It needed some salt. Very bland. The only thing that made it slightly better was the Katsu sauce they provided but that's about it. My friends also ordered the lunch special. Apparently the beef teriyaki was pretty "meh" and the pork ribs were a disaster.

The busboy was a really nice guy who recommended all sorts of things to us but the waitress was not too warm. We thought "maybe that's just how she is" until my friend asked for a straw and she literally threw it at her.
author: Tiffany R.

description:
The food was okay. We tried spicy ramen & beef tongue. Surprised that the chef isn't Japanese or anywhere near it. The owners are friendly though & non Japanese too.  The line was rather short when we were here (Saturday evening)

Quite far from authentic taste (if you travel a lot & have dined in Japan / Asian countries). Not coming back ..
author: Hester D.

description:
More of a miss than a hit.
Okonomiyaki is nowhere near the real deal. Sushi rolls are an insult to the senses. Tempura is poorly prepared. Service is good and staff is friendly, hence earns a 3 star.
author: Andy D.

description:
I can't say Kui Shin Bo is over the top because I really did not try enough to form that kind of opinion but I will definitely go back again and again.
.
For $8.99 I really liked their ramen. I didn't find it salty and it was just overall quite comforting. The combo pizza for $12.49 is exceptionally heavy and not intended to be your main meal but a shared appetizer, dont make my mistake. This pizza was surprisingly different in its fluffy yet lightly crunchy texture and I did enjoy the flavors of the seafood and pork combination, mmm.
.
For $2.00 the green salad with a few shredded carrots and way too much dressing was nothing to write home about. 
.
The service and servers were exceptional in that they explained the menu and were just all around attentive through out my dining experience.
.
I am looking forward to trying their many other options.
author: Caesar A.

description: Had a great lunch meal here. First - the only not so good thing to say is that our server was kind of spacey and we had to remind him several times about our drinks and that we wanted to order. Other than that, the space itself was small, but lovely and comfortable. The food was fantastic and very reasonably priced. I had the pork miso ramen and it was so delicious. I ate the WHOLE thing and left so satisfied and happy. Love it. Would love to go back if in town again.
author: Jo W.

description: This is the best best Japanese restaurant in Japantown.  I'm traveling San Francisco with my kids and they love Japanese manga. After shopping, It is very  hard to choose good one. I read all the reviews and this is the best choice. I enjoy the meal and the staff is very friendly, I will definitely come back again
author: Cindy J.

description:
Slow service. No organized wait list. Food mediocre.  
Came in on Friday around 730 with two group of 5 ahead of us. There was no list to put your name on so you just have to know who was there first, be honest, and to inform restaurant people when they seat people because those aggressive might just take your seat from you. 
Food in general is mediocre. Got the two item combo: ramen with avo roll and some sushi: cucumber sashimi roll and white tuna, sake, eel nigiri. There are better places in the plaza for ramen but for around $10 for two items is not a bad deal if you get other items other than ramen and avo roll. The sushi were just okay. Missing little things like the wasabi in my nigiri and sushi not rolled properly. Three star for great deal and okay food.
author: Naty D.

description: I'm gonna love tball if we get to eat here after games! The service is great and the food came super fast. We where 3rd on the sign in sheet and got called in in less then 10 mins.
author: Evelyn K.

description: New fave sushi in SF! Really fresh sashimi. The house rolls are awesome. Also the pork okonomiyaki was unreal.
author: Ashley B.

description: Cucumber sashimi roll for people who don't eat rice and are missing rolls. Paleo dream come true!! Service was great. Wait not too long even tho the list was long, and the food was tasty and came out quickly. Miso soup was a little bland and a little small but everything else was fabulous!
author: V F.

description:
This is my favorite spot in Japantown, because it's damn good food without all the other gimmicky trappings the mall has.

Yeah, the chairs are short and bordering on too small for my ass, and the wait can be interminable if you get there during peak dining hours, but the shortcomings are outweighed by how personal the service and delicious the food is. 

Combo okonomiyaki is very close to what I ate when I visited Japan several years ago. Sake (salmon) donburi is reasonably priced and always fresh. 

I have also tried their sushi; not mind blowing but it is still pretty good. Come for the appetizers and donburi.
author: Aivy C.

description:
Dee-licious!

Go for the $10 lunch specials.
Saba and veggie tempura really satisfied.  A lunch set comes with miso soup, salad and rice.  Do add soy sauce to the grated daikon, that's what it is for.  
My friend had the curry and shrimp tempura combo.  She loved it and we both agreed the quality and portion was quite good!

Our tea and water was refilled and service was efficient and helpful.  Be sure to get there at 11:30 or else you may be waiting as they do get busy) we went on a Saturday for lunch).

They have a very extensive menu and I can't speak for the other dishes such as the sushi burritos, creative rolls or the ramen, but the lunch specials are what I'll likely be back for. :)
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Authentic, yummy, and affordable Japanese food in the heart of Japantown. Yes, please.

Located in the multiple-Japanese-cultural-experiences-under-one-roof Japan Center Mall in the heart of Japantown. This restaurant can be part of your broader Japantown tour or visit. 

The menu was robust - included ramen, udon, sushi, sashimi, soups, and many other things. They even had specials. I had the curry udon and it was like beef stew with curry. Very hearty, but very yummy. 

The service was excellent. We were greeted and seated quickly. The small restaurant was almost full when we arrived during lunch time. 

The restaurant was clean but a little dated. It added to the 'authentic' feel of the place. 

The prices were reasonable. 

I look forward to returning.
author: David S.

description:
I have no idea why this place has such good reviews. The sushi is not fresh and smells strange. The nigiri isn't as terrible but the rolls are WAY too big (almost impossible to eat it in a single bite)

Will not be back....
author: Victoria H.

description:
Great service: the wait was not too long for 5 people on a Friday night and the waiter was very nice.

Great food: the food was really good! I ordered the Salmon Family roll and the Special Dragon roll. Both delicious! The takoyaki was good but I like them more crunchy. I like how they give you the extra sauce to put on yourself. My friends got the ramen, one tonkatsu and one spicy garlic. That spicy garlic broth was really good, I totally recommend! 
The weird thing to me was they you could only get water or tea on the first order or else you are charged for it? I'm not 100% sure but that's what I understood. The tea was tasty though! 

But, this place is really good I would recommend it and I am definitely coming back!
author: Marilee A.

description:
Cute tiny sushi restaurant in the Japantown plaza. I came here with my family for dinner on a Tuesday evening, and we were seated right away. The size of the restaurant is pretty small, so you may have to wait.

The waiter was helpful recommending dishes and rolls as my family and I were having trouble deciding what to get. 

We ordered a lot of food for 6 people. We got 2 bowls of ramen, at least 5 rolls, sashimi, Saba shio, yakitori, and some appetizers. And the total came out ONLY to be ~$135?! 

Food was pretty good too. The okonomiyaki we ordered was a little burnt on the bottom. 

I recommend getting the Sashimi Cucumber Roll!
author: Linda C.

description:
I was so excited to try this place after a coworker told me how amazing it was and it definitely did not disappoint. Unfortunately I was too starving to take a photo but I got the special with kaki fry and chicken katsu and it was DELICIOUS!! They were fried just the right amount with lots of flavor. The special also came with miso soup, salad, and a bowl of rice. I knocked off one star cause the rice was a little over cooked and chunked together and we had to call over our server twice to get refills on our water. Price was great though (only $10 for my entire meal!!). Definitely better than other overpriced Japanese restaurants. 
There were like 20 options for the special so I definitely need to come back and try the others!!
author: Jackie P.

description: I guess pick your lunch options carefully lol. this little place is nothing fancy but I did enjoy my food, my hubs thought his dishes were a little meh. I opted for an up charge and got sake maki, as I'm allergic to california rolls. The maki and salmon were pretty good, and the fried squid was nice and tender and not over fried. miso also good. tea ok. was not a fan of the salad or the beef
author: Coco J.

description: Prices are cheap for sf and you get a lot of food. Food is good enough to hit the spot when craving for Japanese food, but nothing spectacular. I came for lunch and got the sushi and BBQ pork ribs combo that come with soup and salad for 10.99, but again it wasn't anything special. The meat was a little tough and the sushi was a little salty. On the other hand though, the staff is super friendly and accommodating!
author: Theodora C.

description:
A great family-own Japanese restaurant in Japan town. It opens at 11:30am and there is already a long line 15mins later.

They have this very good lunch deal, in which you can choose two of the 10+ options for 9.99 (w/ miso soup and small salad and rice)

We also ordered a spicy tuna sushi roll. The fish inside was really good and they have some of their sushi made with sticky rice. (I recently found more and more restaurants doing that.)

Their service is pretty slow though, we waited for ~30mins for our sushi and veggie tempura.
author: Xuaner Z.

description: I like this place. It's a hidden gem tucked away in Japan town mall that's successfully developed a cult-like following. The service here is rushed, the staff are motivated to get you in and out to quickly turn tables, yet somehow despite the fast pace, the food is really good. Worth a visit if you're looking for a sushi place near Kabuki theatre.
author: Leann W.

description:
Can't be beat for the price, especially in expensive Japantown! The $9.49 bento special gives you a choice of 2 entree items, rice, miso soup, and salad. I thought the katsu and beef teriyaki were delicious, and my mom was pretty satisfied with her sabaa and tempura as well. Portions are huge, especially for the price. We also shared a scallop roll; large portion as well for around $13. Scallop tasted fresh! We had major food coma afterwards. 

This is located on the 2nd floor of the less crowded mall. Space is pretty tiny and got pretty full/loud during peak dinner hour on a Saturday. Waiter who served us was super friendly, but could have been more attentive. 

Would definitely dine here again next time I'm in Japantown.
author: Kristi T.

description: The okonomiyaki (sort of a cabbage pancake) with veggies was delicious.  The pork tonkatsu was quite good as well.  The service was friendly and the place felt very homey.  Definitely a mom & pop shop.  One of the better restaurants in the Japan Center.
author: Laura S.

description:
I came to this place to try their sushi with my family, but when I ordered caterpillar roll with avocado, they brought me sushi which doesn't look like at the picture and menu, and it didn't have avocado and sesame seeds on it. Plus their waitresses were so rude, instead of apologizing to me they argued with me loudly without speaking English well. Rude customer service, not delicious and not healthy food!
Anyway, I'll never go there again and wouldn't suggest you to try their food!
author: Farangis K.

description:
Usually, I don't take time to write reviews. However this place so bad I needed to share my experience.
 
We ordered a couple of sushi and sashimi options from the costlier side of the menu. Overall, it was reasonable priced for what we supposed to get per menu.   But here is where the fun part comes -- you get the food. It was so bad. It was a joke. It is shameful they call it a sushi. It was really bad, like bad you cant eat it or look at it. It looks like it came from some cartoon or if my toddler made with feet.  I felt scammed and we left after five min. 

Sure... wasted money, but I am hoping I don't end up with any stomach problems. 

Anyways, avoid!!!! 
San Francisco offers so much better options.
author: Chip S.

description: This is a really good place for ramen! The spicy one is very spicy though. I got level 2  and thought it was a bit too spicy for me
author: Tina W.

description: Underwhelming. Katsu tastes like it was left in dryer longer than it should have been resulting in dry chicken katsu. The curry tasted like beef gravy rather than curry. The service was good though I can't say they did anything wrong. Just didn't enjoy the food
author: Ethan S.

description:
Cucumber spicy tuna rolls are the bomb!

This yelp app requested more words so I added them. VS what's up with that?
author: Pete S.

description: Soy milk Ramen and the spicy Ramen are terrible and waited an hr to sit down and receive our food... Disappointed by the second time here. Stick with the chef special thing.
author: Alice S.

description: Japanese food for people who don't know what Japanese food is supposed to taste like. This place is meh at best.
author: S. N.

description:
3.5 stars overall, but I'm rounding up since I enjoyed my Nabeyaki Udon and was thrilled that it cost $9.99 rather than the $15 I pay for my go-to udon place across the street (Udon Mugizo). I'll definitely be coming here instead from now on since I think the noodles here are comparable. I got a big piece of shrimp tempura and plenty of chicken, vegetables, an egg, and noodles in a piping hot pot.

They have an extensive menu with tons of below average prices. As many have noted, they have an amazing meal combo where you can choose 2 items for under $10. The only downside was one of my friends ordered nigiri and was underwhelmed but the fish quality. That said it was also mediocre sushi, so you essentially get what you pay for.

The location of Kuishinbo is in the part of the mall that is definitely a bit more drab and has less foot traffic. In fact, it was my first time venturing to this part of the area. Cleary there are some great hole in the walls to uncover still as there were quite a few other restaurants nearby. I look forward to coming back for more budget friendly meals!
author: Sophia H.

description: Looking for cheap, authentic Japanese food without sacrificing  quality? This is the place. They have such a wide variety of dishes that are all delicious! I wasn't expecting to love this place as much as I did, but it was top-notch. The service was pretty good, too. This is one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in the bay area. I tried the shrimp tempura roll and the negihama roll. Both were flavorful and fresh! Especially for how cheap they were. I also ordered the vegetable croquettes. They were really good! The shrimp tempura was crunchy and light just like I prefer it and the miso was made well. Good miso soup is definitely important to me! I give the food 5 stars and the service 4 and a half! I would definitly recommend this and I will definitely be back!
author: Jimmie M.

description:
Came here solo on a weekday around 3pm on a Friday. Did have to write my name on the list as it was packed. Luckily being alone I managed to get the bar area to sit.

Ordered the special yakisoba which was served on a sizzling plate. The food was great and the service was warm and cozy like being in a mom and pop shop, which I always liked.

I'll be back again the next time around
author: Kenneth L.

description:
Small restaurant in the East mall in Japantown. It can get packed so get there when it opens to minimize wait time. 

While the food was decent, service was very slow. We ordered the salmon mango roll which was flavorful and had a nice sweet and spicy sauce to it. I got the kitsune udon. The udon broth was a little light for my taste but the noodles were a perfect al dented. My boyfriend got the katsu curry. He said the sauce tasted a bit more Chinese than Japanese to him. He was expecting a thicker gravy. 

Overall, prices are pretty good and they even have a menu where you can get two items for $9.99. Food is decent but don't come here if you're in a hurry.
author: Joan S.

description: I ordered the chirashi and it was good. This restaurant has a lot of options on the menu and pretty good pricing. Not mind blowing, but overall a good place to grab dinner with a friend.
author: Michelle T.

description:
reasonable is definitely the word for this small sushi/ramen restaurant. this was our first time dining here n I expected a full meal n that's what I got. 

looking from the outside, the small hole in the wall shop has a homey feel to it. it's located on the second floor in the Peace Plaza of Japantown. it's a mom n pop store run by an elderly gentlemen who is very accommodating to its customers. he recommended their lunch combo meals to us for its reasonable price n good variety. so that's what both of us ordered. 

the two combo meals were filling. we were both pretty full after finishing it all. the quality was ok. I wouldn't say it was amazing food, but it's something we would go back to eat if we were hungry. maybe try other things on their huge menu. 

Shrimp Tempura w/ Ramen combo : the ramen was just a pack of noodles put into some soup. I would order one of their specialty ramen next time. the shrimp tempura was cooked really good. 2 pieces of crispy large prawns. 

Tonkatsu w/ California Roll combo : the tonkatsu was big altho not juicy like a specialty tonkatsu shop would have. (it's not kurobuta pork so lower your expectations.) the California rolls were decent.
author: Julie W.

description:
The special comes with 2 of your choices with miso, rice, and salad for only $9.99! I had the tonkatsu and the shrimp tempura - don't recommend the tonkatsu because it doesn't come with much meat; however, the shrimp tempura was perfectly fried that it was golden and crispy without being overwhelming oily, and you can actually taste the shrimp. In addition, I was impressed with the well-cooked rice that's still fluffy and moist! Although rice is not the main dish, it plays an important role in a pleasant meal! 
Besides the food, I was surprised by how trusting the owners are. There was a blackout for a short 5 minutes, since the cash register didn't work, the owner let one of the customers to withdrawal cash from the ATM without having them leave anything on hold! Also, the owner even offered to light the candle for us. 
Decent meal, reasonable price, and terrific customer service :)
author: Jennifer F.

description:
After searching around Japantown at around 1pm for restaurants, my friends and I settled on Kui Shin Bo due to its high ratings on Yelp. (Previously, we had ejected ourselves from a nearby restaurant's waiting list when we learned it had 2.5 stars on Yelp) I was lured in by the promises of "reasonable prices." 

We placed ourselves, a party of four, on the waiting list at around 1:45pm, and we found a place to sit and wait. We were finally seated at 3:15pm, over an hour later. The servers were very friendly, and told us about the specials menu - 2 items PLUS miso soup, salad, and rice for $9.49. I decided on the Wakame Udon and Chicken Katsu. When the waiter took our order, she let me know that because I chose the udon noodles, I wouldn't get rice and salad. This was no indication of this condition listed anywhere on the specials menu, so I was a little confused. 

The food finally came after 4pm, after patrons who were seated AFTER us had already gotten their food (about ten minutes before the first dish was served to our table). The food itself wasn't bad - the Chicken Katsu was crispy, although the Wakame Udon was very bland. My meal also showed up without miso soup, add further insult to injury. Although the food itself was alright, the extremely long wait and the weird restrictions on the special dishes did not make this place worth it.
author: Krissy W.

description: great food at affordable prices. especially the lunch special, I usually eat alot but it fills me up. service is great, the place is quaint.  service is amazing
author: Ray L.

description: Overhyped on yelp. The waiter seemed like he was sick or something weird. The inside of restaurant seemed really small and chairs were miniature. Now to the food. I ordered the sashimi a la carte and the fish was not room temperature and instead it was more cold (like it came out of a freezer and defrosted). The sashimi we ordered was yellow tail, salmon and tuna and the best out of all of them had to be the salmon. Then, my friends and I ordered the nigiri combo and it was of same quality as the sashimi, just okay. The best things we had here were the house special rolls; the pink lady roll and the dragon roll were great but the dragon roll seemed like it was just too much stuff all on it. The simpler pink lady roll was the best thing here.  Overall, not impressed by Japan Town food. I will only come to Japan Town to shop, not eat.
author: Ricardo R.

description: Walked in, place was pretty full.  We had the Odon and some sushi.  Noodles were good but sushi was just okay.  Would recommend only if looking for noodles and pass on the sushi.
author: Aaron C.

description:
I was looking for a local spot in Japantown to eat. As a world traveler, I'm always finding the local spots...so while staying in Japantown, I had to try what seemed like the smallest and most reputable Japanese restaurant.

I stopped in for a quick meal. Kui had a lunch special for $9.99(unheard of in SF) which included two entrees, miso and salad. I ordered the Teriyaki chicken and spider roll. This was a hearty meal and fulfilling for what I wanted. Portions were generous and tasty. It's not the most/best fantastic food...it was pretty damn good though! I'd give them a solid 8.5/10. 

The place is small and only has about 25 seats, so your wait could be minimal. When I went at 6p on a Thursday it was quiet but started to get busy. 

I'd would recommend this place and also return when back in the area. It's inside the Japantown Mall upstairs...so no signage or direction...just go inside and upstairs...it's tucked away. Took me a few mins to find, but worth the trip.
author: Gregorio P.

description: Love their $10.99 lunch special. The portions are small, but you get so many things, that it fills you up well. I got the avokayo rolls (avocado & cucumber) and the agadashi tofu meal, both were amazingly tasty. And you get a tiny salad (just a few bites) a bowl of rice and a bowl of miso soup. This is my favorite place to go with my son who has been teaching me everything Japanese lately!
author: Venus S.

description: Delicious - we had two lunch special ramen, gyoza and gobo.  Will be back again! Kid approved!
author: kimberly C.

description: Really sub part sushi and rude waiter. Spend your money elsewhere. All their rolls had shrimp tempura and very little quality fish
author: Paul S.

description:
Dropped in here on a visit to SF, and was pleasantly surprised.  Showed up for a very late lunch but it was packed.  Probably 230 PM on a Friday.  Ordered the 2 item board lunch (tonkatsu and ramen) and my friend ordered a variation of that.  We also got two regular rolls salmon and yellowtail.  We definitely did not need the rolls.  The board lunches were huge and delicious!  The ramen wasn't my favorite I've ever had, but it was cold outside and I wanted it anyway.

I'll definitely come back.  Can't believe the total was $35 before tip for all that good food.
author: Mike A.

description:
I'd like to preface this by saying that I did not experience any issues in regards to wait times, the restaurant was full but the flow of customers entering and leaving was steady throughout my meal. 

I ordered the black garlic ramen with a side of gyoza. All and all, I can say that the star of the show was most definitely the ramen. It was packed to the brim with mushrooms, bamboo shoots, nori (seaweed), chashu roasted pork, green onions and topped with an egg. The broth was a special garlic tonkatsu broth, which I had altered to a spice level of 3 out of 4. Each bite felt so full and hearty, there was always something interesting to pick out of my bowl! I do want to say that although this is advertised as a garlic ramen, the sole garlic provider in this equation is the broth. In my case, this was perfect as I don't like overdoing it on the garlic.

The gyoza proved to be the perfect intermittent snack. The dipping sauce acted as a pallet cleanser, salting my tongue and washing in preparation for more ramen. The gyoza itself was alright, however the dipping sauce definitely carried the duo.

All in all, I give this place five stars for a few reasons. The first of them being VALUE. Your money goes far here, and there plenty of options for those who don't have the largest budget (customizable combo plates all day long, special meals and cheap deals over all). To add, the employees are cheerful and engaging. I had a ~10 minute conversation with the owner and my host and I really appreciate workers who interact with their customers like that.
author: Sebastian B.

description: My favorite place to eat sushi in Japan town!! The owner and the staff are so friendly and food is amazing!! Got to try it.
author: Mohannad F.

description: Fantastic food.   They even provided steak teriyaki minus the sauce for my seven year old with Celiac.   He enjoyed his "steak" with gluten free soy sauce.   Everyone else enjoyed their various sushi dishes.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
Slow to serve fast to bring your check.
My experience here can be described as terrible at best. We arrived when the restaurant was not busy at all yet still took us 30 minutes to get seated even though there were 2 tables available that could seat our party of 3. Even after we got seated the server took another 10 minutes to even bring our water let alone ask for our order. The server was also extremely rude, not a single please or thank you and would drop menus on the table instead of placing. Mind you, our orders were 3 simple rolls but the wait for our food was yet another 40 minutes. At this point its been close to an hour and a half before we got our food and before we had even finished eating, the server/manager dropped off the check without saying a word. The staff is extremely disrespectful and not worth the time wasted and money spent.
author: Brandon K.

description: I stayed 2 days in Kabuki hotel and 2 days in another hotel near here so I just went and found this sushi restaurant. Outside of it looked not good so I worried but I gave a shot. I loved it! Food was tasty and I might go back next time.
author: Christine T.

description:
Got the agedashi tofu and saba combo for ~$10 (comes with rice, salad, and miso soup). My boyfriend got the udon and shrimp tempura combo (comes with vegetable tempura too). This was a filling, affordable, solid meal. Food was great. Workers were great. Decor was great.

My only complaint would be that the food took quite a long time to come out but it's a small restaurant and it was crowded for Sunday lunch so it's understandable.
author: Christine L.

description: Young long haired homeboy. Don't be chewing gum while you servin. Especially w your mouth open . Food was coo tho
author: Andrew P.

description: We visit SF once a year and this is our 2nd  time at Kui Shin Bo. Both times the sushi was very good and the value was excellent. This time I ordered the tuna a la carte sushi.  It included 9 pieces of fresh tuna, rice, salad and miso soup for a very reasonable price.  I was very full afterward. We'll be back next year.
author: Jon F.

description: Hands down, the BEST fried house tofu I've ever had. There's a longer wait for it, but well worth the wait for the crispy pillows of tofu. yum! The Volcano roll had just the right portion of seafood to rice, a bit of heaven in your mouth.
author: Tina T.

description: This place is awesome! Quite a hidden gem, but really the best sushi I've had in San Francisco so far. I've had the vegetable tempure rolls, the veggie sushi burrito, and their tamago. Everything has been amazing so far. Not too expensive for sushi either. Love it!
author: Madeleine M.

description:
Small little family restaurant tucked in a quiet corner on the east wing.

It's hard to notice this place unless you happen to be really looking for it. There are usually "specials" on a large menu outside, where you can order combinations of different kinds of food (teriyaki, tempura, udon, rice etc.) for some good deal prices. The amount of traffic is usually low due to its location, but the food is ok. The nabeyaki is pretty big, with lots of udon, but not a lot of toppings (a tempura and some cabbage, with some small bits of chicken). That's kind of expected due to the cheap prices.

Overall, this place feels like a family restaurant--it feels like I went to a friend's place and they cooked some homemade stuff. Nothing fancy, but clearly simply cooked and in big portions, with not a lot of crazy seasoning.

A good place to stop by if you're craving simple homemade Japanese stuff
author: Henry L.

description: What an amazing place. I had two roles for under $30 and left full.  The volcano Roll was amazing. It's a huge Roll with shrimp tempura, tuna salmon and a mound of crab. I think I could eat here everyday. I tried other rolls as well and they are all good. I will be back next time I'm in SF.
author: Wes M.

description: Haven't had Japanese food in a while and this placed satisfied my craving. The takoyaki was probably the least satisfying thing we ordered but it was still really good. The pork okonomiyaki and bacon wrapped enoki were really delicious and the sushi rolls were tasty too.
author: Jarryd V.

description:
I will come back here!! Finally I got some chirashi that is quite generous, full of fish variety and at a reasonable price!!! That is what Chirashi is supposed to be!! Very generous portion, better than many that are priced over 20 in many other Restaurants!! 
Highly recommended!! Ps, I eat sushi or Japanese every week and I am very happy to have found this place!
author: April W.

description:
Great little restaurant with the best deal in Japantown: $8.99 for two items, rice, miso soup, and salad.  My two items were veggie tempura and chicken katsu.  I was thinking of ordering tamago, but the combo had filled me up!  I also ordered hot green tea, which also had a hint of rice.. it was delicious!

There wasn't a lot of people, so the food came out quickly.  Service was friendly and attentive.  If you want to get away from the crowds and inflated prices, you should try Kui Shin Bo.
author: Vira P.

description:
I really like the rolls here.
My suggestion is to order Volcano Roll and Spring roll.
One has a lot of flavor and the other one is really light and fresh.
I also ordered their seafood okonomiyaki, very very tasty.
author: Chia C.

description:
Good place we found in Japantown! Their specialty rolls we liked were the spicy crunchy roll and the deep fried California roll. The ramen looked very good! It seemed to have a regular crowd because every party that came in talked to the owner for a while. 
We also got pork katsu which was good with the sauce they gave us!
author: Katie C.

description:
4Star was a good recommendation. Also, I'd eaten here quite a few years ago with a friend that ordered directly from the sushi man and it was very good. This experience was most disappointing.  As others here have suggested, my favorite way to evaluate sushi restaurants is to compare the chirashizushi. 

For $16.49, this was the worst ever at any price. The fish was uniformly lacking in flavor for reasons not attributable to shime/preparation, nothing actually off/spoiled but more like terminal freezer burn. I had to ask for some wasabi and used more of that and soy sauce than I would for better quality food. The shari/rice was under seasoned.

Service was perfunctory, staff eating and talking  behind sushi bar counter. No return, no recommendation.
author: YearOf M.

description: Very tasty sushi, sashimi and udon for a very reasonable price by SF standards. The menu is huge. Staff was attentive but not intrusive, you can have 2 pints of Asahi for scarcely more than the price of one (of you order a large), and they have vegetarian options beyond just the usual single avocado roll. The tempura veggie roll was great and they have a veggie option for gyoza that was pretty good. They also have cucumber sesame rolls. So they certainly have vegetarian options. We had the spicy salmon roll (dynamite roll) which was absolutely delicious. The uni was great too. For something different get the meat lover's roll, which was really satisfying and beefy and not something you usually see in a sushi menu. They also bring generous amounts of ginger and wasabi with your rolls. All I can say is the place next door was empty, and this place was packed. We're coming back!
author: J C.

description:
horrible service. the older lady doesnt get my order after telling her twice, and then gives me attitude after i ask her where my food is! then i ask for a to go container and she tosses it at me. i had my hand outstretched and she throws it on the table. IT LANDS ON THE PLATE OF FOOD WAS.
i promise i never gave her attitude.
if i could give zero stars i would.
author: Justin M.

description:
Went in for lunch and they had a great deal for lunch special (two mini dish with miso soup, rice and salad for 9.99)

But I wanted sushi, and asked for recommendation from one of the waiter. He was kind and introduce me to some of their specialities and customer favorites. So I order: 

Cucumber roll: a roll use thinly sliced fresh cucumber wrap around 3 types of sashimi. So refreshing. Highly recommended 

Volcano roll: hearty roll about a foot long, with tempera shrimps and crab meat mix with a bit of mayo (I am salvaging as I am writing this).

Will go back again and try more sushi!
author: Ada C.

description:
Good for late night.  Service is good and the hot tea hit the spot on a windy, SF night.  The prices are reasonable and portions as one might expect.  

The spicy tuna poke salad was delicious and particularly enjoyable if medium spicy is preferred.  Katsu curry looked like it had beef in it though.  Good restaurant to try out.
author: A P.

description: Very reasonable prices relative to all the other Japanese restaurants in Japantown. You can get a full dinner combination for $10. Good-sized portions and I've always been satisfied with the quality of the food. Get there early and put your name on the list as they tend to have a wait at peak dinner times.
author: V V.

description: The wait wasn't too long despite being a small establishment. People were on top of turning over the tables which can be the most frustrating part of waiting. They are small and it feels family owned. The sashimi was fresh and my friend and I split one of the larger sashimi plates with edamame and it was perfect.
author: Ashley I.

description:
Came to this place because it got four stars and it was open at 2 pm. Overall not a bad place to eat especially if you are looking for something quick. Don't come here if you are looking for amazing fish quality. The price is great for what you get. 

For lunch, you can choose two items with rice, miso soup, and salad for $9.49. Nigiri is around $3.50 for two and rolls are around 7-13 depending on what you get. 

Clean place, no restrooms, good service, not bad food. I personally would recommend the bento box selection over than eating sushi here.
author: Jackie N.

description:
The service here is very inattentive. The waiter hardly glanced at us as he took our orders, took our menus, and gave us our check. I tried to get his attention several times but he wasn't responding.

I ordered the teriyaki chicken and broiled mackerel dish with rice and miso. The fish was practically tasteless, and hard to eat since it was very small but full of little bones and scales. The chicken wasn't grilled, as it is supposed to be. It seemed to be just regular pan fried chicken thrown in with some syrupy teriyaki sauce. The miso soup was also very bland. 

My daughter ordered the udon, which was in a very bland broth, but overall a lot better than what I ordered. Not a very authentic experience considering the location.
author: Mom P.

description: I shared a bowl of miso ramen and a beef teriyaki bento box with shrimp tempura and it was great. The beef teriyaki was also well trimed of all the fat which I feel is a problem with other restaurants teriyaki beef. The chicken in the ramen was seasoned perfectly. There was a small wait but the food was worth it. The service was quick and the whole meal was under 30$. I will definitely be returning soon.
author: Samantha T.

description:
The food wasn't awful, but it wasn't good either. Felt like Japanese food made by someone who's never actually eaten Japanese food. Cordial, but rather terrible service. Waiter didn't know or understand what was on the menu when ordering, had to point at the menu and even then he seemed confused. 

Agedashi Tofu: meh. It was ok. Wouldn't get agedashi here again, though.

Karaage: less like the golden delicious chunks of fried chicken it should have been, and more like processed chicken nuggets you can find in the supermarket frozen section. 

Shrimp Tempura: just...odd. Turned out more like some kind of glorified shrimp poppers with entirely too much batter. Like... oodles of batter, ridiculously absurd amounts of batter, so much that the shrimp looked like it'd grown wings. 

Katsu curry: the katsu was ok. Had decent texture, though it was a bit chewy. The curry was a bit of a joke. Taste was off, still can't put my finger on exactly what it was, but again it felt like someone totally foreign to Japanese curry read about it online and decided to run with the idea. Odd texture, too: it seemed like they put corn starch or something.

Overall, would not recommend. Didn't try any sushi, but I'd be hesitant to given their difficulty in pulling off far easier dishes.
author: Brad M.

description:
I went here with a group of 5 the Sunday before labor day around 7pm. The wait was around an hour (the place is pretty small), but we weren't in a rush because we weren't that hungry and there is a lot to do around the mall. This place is a really good deal! You can get a 2 item combo for under $10.

I ordered the beef teryaki, squid tempura, and split the sushi and sashmi platter with my boyfriend. It took over 30 minutes to get our food, which was making me pretty impatient after already waiting so long to get a table. Overall, everything was pretty good, but average. I probably wouldn't come again if the wait was as long, but I would come back if there were some free tables.
author: Cynthia M.

description: I don't know wtf these people were saying 4/5 stars. More like no stars if there was an option. It was my best friends b day and I swear I ruined it by picking this place. From the caterpillar to my sushi rainbow burrito and of all the places this was a horrible meal in JTOWN! ON EASTER AND MY FRIEND BDAY! It was so disgusting! The fish was warm, the sushi rice had no vinegar flavor, I just felt sick to my stomach even eating the raw fish. This is how you know it was a horrible meal, McDonald's would have been a better meal choice for the night. It made Ronald McDonald achieve a Michelin star that night....THAT'S HOW YOU KNOW THIS WAS THE MOST HORRIBLE OUTRAGEOUSLY DISGUSTING MEAL I HAVE EVER IN MY LIFE TASTED. I hate Mimi cafe and even that was more worthy to eat. Do yourself all a favor, don't come here unless you want to eat pile of dog shit.
author: Rika I.

description: Yaassss!  Yelp fam, we owe you for this find.  This hole in the wall in Japantown is the ideal lunch spot.  We stopped by on a busy, rainy Sunday, but we only waited 15 minutes. We took the spots at the counter.  My sushi-loving daughter and I shared a lunch special(2 items chosen were California Roll and tempura), edamame, and the Pink Lady rolls.  Everything was so delicious that I'm worried about hitting up our local spots; the bar has been reset.
author: Julie C.

description: Bad. Neither delicious nor authentic. No katsuobushi on Takoyaki. Odd sauce. Oily and unfresh tempura. Only reason here is they are open at 3pm while other good restaurants are closed.
author: Chengshu Z.

description: Sushi places in Japan town are really hit or miss in my experience. I've had some of my worst sushi experiences in this area ironically. But this place has lifted my hopes back up! We were starving - had a bit of a wait because the place is quite small and tight, but it was well worth it. Volcano roll is a MUST! As well as the spider. Great service. Will make this our new usual sushi spot for sure
author: Felicia C.

description:
Frustrating. I wasn't really sure if they will notice us to get you seated, so you are awkwardly standing there waiting while they are either in the back or focused on current table customers. It's a very small place, so it can get pretty stuffy in here due to body heat. 

One thing I noticed is that, their service isn't that great. They didn't offer us any water or paid attention to our table. We were ready to order, but they have not notice us until we had to flag a server down. All I got as a response is not a "sorry," but "oh." It's a small shop, I don't understand how you don't notice your customers. Keep in mind, it was not busy at all. We came in around 230pm, there were few tables occupied. 

When we ordered, the server somewhat gave us an attitude and wasn't welcoming at all. I ordered the Miso ramen, and I read the description for it.. it either offered Chashu Roasted Pork or Chicken, so of course, I let them know I wanted the roasted pork option, but he replied with "what do you mean? You can't have two item together." I know there's just a Chashu Ramen, I want the Miso Ramen with the chashu roasted pork meat as my option in my soup, not the Chashu Ramen. 

I'm very disappointed in the service and it was our first time here given that it's a 4 star restaurant on yelp. I wanted to like this place, but it gave me the vibe that they didn't want us here. I would've rather just got up and walked off, but I wanted to wait and see if the food here is tasty. 

The broth of the Miso ramen was average, not bad. The meat was a bit hard to chew. I did like the fact that they had bean sprouts! It was yummy with it and the egg was soft as well. Overall, I did had better ramen in flavor wise. 

I wouldn't come back here or recommend it to my friends. The food was good, but the service was really lacking.
author: Irene L.

description: So good. Seated so fast and the food was bomb. We got the lunch specials. So good.
author: Marissa F.

description:
This was my first time coming here and saw the ratings ! After searching for a good sushi place, we stumble across this place. When we got here there was already a wait list.. it was long, but the place was smaller than expected.. There are only two big tables that fit a group of six and I believe 7/8 small tables that fit a group of four. We got there around 7ish me we waited for almost 1 hour and half because the big table people wouldn't leave. They took forever to leave.. After all the people left, the adults still sat there and continue drinking.. which was ridiculous .. I'm not sure if the wait was worth it but the food was good. 

They had a special menu outside where you pick any two and you get miso, rice, and salad for $9.49. The food took about 20-30 mins to come out, but it was delicious. I got the chicken katsu & California roll (6 piece) and the katsu was crispy and delicious. My boyfriend got ramen & California roll but if you got ramen you don't get the soup,rice, and salad. 

Also, try to come a bit early before their closing time because once their wait list gets long they close the waitlist and won't take anyone after they close down the waitlist. But they won't close till they finished the waitlist then they will start closing. We were the last group to go in because we were a big group and the people didn't want to leave. But they were still happy with the service (:

It's a bit hard to find but its within the shopping mall !
author: Winnie H.

description:
Delicious. Really good sushi, great service, great cost. Some of the best sushi I've ever had. I wasn't the biggest fan of the sushi burrito but that's more personal preference than the actual taste. Their rolls were good and creative; the fish is good and it's a normal amount of food (in terms of sushi). There are plenty of deals too, though when I went none were for sushi.

They don't take reservations and it does get crowded. I recommend going here for some affordable and good sushi if you're around. I'm also sure there is better sushi in the bay area, but Kui Shin Bo is really good!
author: Yuri K.

description:
I have nothing to complain about (which rarely happens) hence, the PERFECT score.  I think the wait time would have been an issue had we waited, but we didn't because fortunately, we missed the lunch rush.  This place is tiny and tucked away in a tinier corner of "Shopping Mall #2" in Japan Town.  You can't miss it because eateries around it closed down.  Now I know it's because even as tiny as it is, it packs a pretty big punch!

Service was sweet, sushi was immaculate and the FREE hot tea was sooooo good!  I just appreciated walking into an establishment and getting everything I expected to get and MORE!  Funny thing is, I wasn't even expecting as much considering the last minute plan and of course, being in a new place I always have my doubts.

But yes, it was a great experience and I WILL be back. 

Thank you.
author: Myrnelle G.

description:
Very reasonable prices, great service and yummy food. They have a good mix of sushi and kitchen food. We stopped in by chance as the place is typically closed on Mondays.

Will look forward to coming back soon.
author: Robert L.

description:
Cute little store right next to ichiban-kan :3

Definitely worth the monies if you're craving for more than just one japanese dish. Their lunch special is such a good deal. Definitely fulfilled my cravings for both veggie tempura and tonkatsu. Tonkatsu was REALLY good, this is a must order.  I was super satisfied to have both for the price of one. The bf got a chicken katsu and curry rice. You can order from a large list of any weird combo of 2 things, like udon + tempura, or ramen + curry rice, etc. Basically this place is a great one to solve your cravings for a good price of about 9.99. :3 Definitely coming back here :)

Another plus is the waiter seemed like a sweet guy.
author: Mel T.

description: This place was busy! They had a long waiting list, but some people didn't get back when called so we got our table after about 15 mins--lucky us! Ordered sashimi mix, tempura udon, tonkatsu ramen, black garlic ramen, grilled squid, and a few nigiri. The fish were fresh. The udon and tempura was good. The ramens were the best!!!! I would come back again for the ramen for sure--- perfect broth, not too salty like a lot of ramen places. It's a small restaurant with only tables for two and four, so they'll put groups of two with another couple to share a table. Community eating almost :) Nice staff and quick service.
author: Diep L.

description:
This review is strictly for the sushi. Everything else was fine; I ate a late lunch, so it wasn't very busy and I didn't wait at all to sit or be served. 

The sashimi was the worst quality I've ever had. It had absolutely no flavor, just watery blandness, and definitely not fresh (as in frozen, not like it had gone bad).

Seems like the great reviews praise the ramen, so try that and skip the sushi.
author: Nicole A.

description:
Came in on a whim, stayed for the yelp + value! 
Tucked away in the corner of the second story building in the East Plaza, we found our way here through a cardinal sense of direction and an empty stomach. 

Lunch Special: BBQ Short Ribs & Squid Tempura
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kui-shin-bo-san-francisco-2?select=ZApRXSkkBJ9PKfa0eKl3VA)
The Lunch special was definitely a value - good quality and quantity. I am very knit-picky when it comes to my calamari b/c it is usually overcooked and has the consistency of hard plastic. To my surprise, this place delivered a great calamari tempura with light breading and fresh squid. The BBQ short ribs were typical and not really noteworthy, but it met my expectations. A very quaint and nice location that is conducive for intimate conversation. Service was overall very friendly and the bill was not pushed upon us till requested. Will be back...after I try some other JTown places! 
 
tldr;

PRO: Great value and great calamari! 

Con: Other choices available!
author: Matthew S.

description: With all the positive reviews on Yelp we had moderately high expectations for this place, and the extensive menu also had us hopeful. Unfortunately it really disappointed: the teriyaki sauce was syrupy and bland; the best word I can use to describe the unagi is "wet"; and the sushi rice had that translucent mashed look of supermarket sushi that has been sitting out all day.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Great little 10 table place tucked in the corner of the second floor of the Japantown peace plaza. 

Sushi was fantastic! I don't know why reviews are poor, maybe the wait and size didn't help. Service was great and quick.
author: Juan M.

description:
Family run business. Great lunch combos choose two entrees and it comes with rice and miso soup. Except noodle entrees which doesn't not come with rice. Space is small, so try to come early since it gets pretty packed. 

The kitchen food takes a while to prepare but it's well worth the wait. I got the Wakame cold soba noodle and really liked it. Sushi bar or cold food comes out faster, so if you're hungry order some sushi with your meal.
author: Stephanie C.

description: food (ordered a couple of rolls, pancake and fried oysters) was definitely good, decent service, but the restaurant itself is pretty tiny inside and prices were a little high. would i go back?? eventually, but with soooo many other sushi places in the area, restaurants need to stand out and set themselves apart (maybe specialize in a specific dish(es), over-the-top fresh ingredients, or be the absolute best at what they do while balancing cheap prices, etc.,) and didn't really this place does that.
author: Mike C.

description: This place is now one of my favorite Japanese restaurants out there, and I'll gladly explain why. They offer a special that for $9.99, you choose two entrees (I chose the Cali roll & shrimp tempura) and miso soup, salad, and rice are included. I thought the food would be in very small portions, but there was enough that I couldn't even finish it. Their Cali roll was delicious and one of the best I've had, the miso soup was perfect, and everything else was a treat. I couldn't believe that for $10 I had more than enough delicious food. If you ever end up here, you won't regret it!
author: Maria D.

description: Staff here was super nice. Sushi was all delicious. Disappointed with Garlic Edamame-wasn't what I was used to. Banana split was very good.
author: Ed O.

description:
I am not sure why this place is so highly rated. The food was really salty and greasy. The service was bad as well.

I ordered pork okomiyaki and one ramen and beef teriyaki for two people. The first one came out was the combo beef and ramen. Ramen was really salty with only one piece meat. It tastes almost as good as my instant ramen. Beef was dry and no favor and slightly burned. Next was Okomiyaki that was underwhelming and quite greasy.

Service was really slow. The whole time we was there, they never checked if we need extra water or tea.

No one should come here.
author: Hai Q.

description:
Probably in my top 5 sushi places worldwide

Everything is fresh .. Fresh ingredients fresh made

Friendly people and great price!
author: Sjoerd N.

description: I always visit this place when my brother is in town. It's our most go-to because of the price and great food. Try their saba shio set with rice and miso! Yum.
author: Elva M.

description:
Wow, this small place packs up quick for dinner. You get a lot of food for a great price. Just heads up, it might take up to half an hour for your food to be ready after you order. It seems that they try to have all dishes for everyone ready before serving them, but they did miss one.

Dinner Combo w/ Calamari and Beef Teriyaki: beef was nice and tender and the sauce was good.

Sushi and Sashimi Platter: the rice was overcooked. Usually the rice should be fanned right after so that it doesn't get too sticky/gelatinous.
author: James N.

description:
Mediocre food, terrible service.

Got the lunch bento special (chicken katsu and shrimp tempura) and a dynamite roll. It took 20 minutes to get my food. Meanwhile, I was given warm tap water to drink as a server repeatedly bumped into my chair as he walked by. During the meal, I had to ask several times for a single refill of water (at least the refill was with cold water), and had a similar experience with the check.

I don't know why this place is so popular. I guess it's because of the cheap lunch special. Do yourself a favor and pay the $2 extra or whatever to eat somewhere decent.
author: Mike S.

description:
Stopped by this spot before a show in SF. Great eats and drink prices. 

For $55 we fed three adults and still had more to go around. They have a pick 2 special for lunch and dinner and I went with California Roll + Udon combo. It was tasty and generous portions. My gf and her brother got katsu + rolls and katsu + teriyaki. 

Overall good experience and quick way to chow down on good food. I'd return and try another combo off of their wide selection. 

Beer + Sake was reasonable pricing as well (tall bottle of beer, $5; large Sake, $5)
author: Alexander K.

description:
Food was below mediocre, server was even less desirable. When I told him that one of the special rolls was pretty bad he laughed at us and said "yeah but you ordered it, so..." 
I will never return here.
author: Derrick D.

description: Sadly, I fell for the Yelp reviews. I picked this over Mifune Don because of the overall rating. We were famished and came here to fix our chicken Katsu and teriyaki cravings. There was something wrong with the teriyaki chicken. As if the sauce were added after cooking the chicken - and it was cold. I realized the teriyaki I've had at the malls as a child was much better. The agedashi tofu was tasteless. The curry of curry rice tasted like paste and was really not what I'd have expected. In any case, I needed to share this out there and not let Yelp reviews sway me into these decisions in the future!
author: Pramida P.

description:
Kei Shin Bo has been here for years, but only until now I've decided to give this place a try. We were greeted and served by a gentleman who I think is possibly the owner, but I could be wrong. Regardless, he seemed to take pride on what they had to offer. This was a good sign from the get go.

I've kept my distance from their sushi menu and strictly stuck with their kitchen dishes. We ordered sesame chicken, tonkatsu, kaki fry, and a large Asahi. Also, we added katsu made with fish per recommendation. All dishes were excellent! I was quite surprised on how great they all tasted. I'm quite a snob when it comes to Japanese cuisine and that says a lot. I'm returning no doubt and likely try their sushi the next time around.
author: Gene B.

description: Took away one star only because it's kind of hard to find being on the second story of a mini shopping mall. But overall it was clean, had great service, and the food came out quickly. Their edemame was great as well as their shrimp tempura roll and some deep fried roll I got. I'd def get it again! Reasonable pricing as well!
author: Jessica M.

description:
Went here for lunch on a weekend and was told the wait would be close to an hour so I put my name down and returned 35 minutes later. When I returned my name had been crossed off and was told that I would have to put my name down again and wait all over again. I asked the host to seat us next like every other restaurant I've been to would do, but even then they refused and insisted we wait.

I decided to take my belly and my business elsewhere - this restaurant doesn't understand that people may want to explore Japantown while they wait and insists instead they hover right outside the door. This kind of service really deserves 0 stars.
author: Emanuel H.

description:
