I was high as fuck when I came here but I remember thinking this place was delicious (but I mean I was high so... Everything's delicious to me). My boyfriend, who was sober, really enjoyed this place also. You get good sushi for cheap, who can beat that!

This place is hidden in the peace plaza and it can be hard to find. Definitely a hole in the wall with really good and cheap sushi.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
Pretty good lunch deal for the area, $10 for a combo with sizeable portions and decent quality considering the price. Our table took a while to get the food, but the others seemed to be fine. We got a garlic noodle and katsu combo- katsu was good but garlic noodles a bit oily. I also got a ramen and Saba (mackerel) combo. The fish was good though lots of bones, and the ramen was just noodles in Chinese soup broth.

Anyway this was good enough considering the limited options in the vicinity if you are looking for something simple with a lot of options. I wish the service had been faster but I would still come back if this was an exception and not the norm.
author: Nancy W.

description: Today's lunch was actually great compares to the previous time. Hubby's here for the  first time and he loved it.
author: M. N.

description:
Their food is okay and service is friendly. The price is really affordable as well. 

So why 2 stars? Well. I think if you're a patient person with a lot of time, this place would deserve more like 4 stars. Unfortunately I don't have a patience to wait for 40+ minutes every time I order here.  Sorry I just can't do it. :(
author: mona k.

description: This my absolute favorite Japanese food restaurant. It is a small place but intimate. There's a wide variety of food including delicious but affordable sushi, yakitori, ramen, and udon. My girlfriend and I frequent this place as a go-to spot
author: Jin N.

description:
This perhaps is the gem of of japan town. By far one of the cheapest places to grab Japanese and the deal is superb! Its an intimate, little setting nestled in a mall. For less then 10 dollars you can get a combo deal. You get giant portions of 2 dishes of your choice with salad and miso soup on the side. I was stuffed and the food is so quality especially for the price point . Will be back many more times. Very friendly owner who has great recs. 

Get the Katsu and curry, what a great combo!
author: Pat C.

description: Kui Shin Bo is a great place to stop for a quick bite to eat! My boyfriend and I come here regularly as we live close by and usually order off the set menu ($10.99) with extra nigiri. The food always tastes great and the service is very friendly! The decor is old school but feels very authentic and cosy. This place is tucked away in one of the malls in Japan town but it definitely worth seeking out!
author: Hannah D.

description:
Nice spot! We tried the mad spicy ramen (level 2) and it was perfect. 
The sashimi cucumber roll was too cucumber-y. 
And the fish was good - we had nigiri- salmon, hamachi and white tuna
author: Parminder Nayyar C.

description:
Cute little ramen and sushi shop nestled in the west mall (I think) of Japan town.  We got lucky and didn't have to wait but it seems like it could fill up fast since they have such limited seating, so get there early to beat a rush.

My boyfriend had the jia jia ramen and I had the sushi family roll.  The roll has sushi skin, sushi, mango, avocado, cream cheese, with sushi roe on top.  However upon taking a bite my mouth was filled with cream cheese.  Ended up picking the salmon off and eating it without the cream cheese. 

It was still good, service was prompt, and their tea was amazing I couldn't get enough.  Would recommend, but don't get the sushi family roll!
author: Eileen H.

description:
Went to Japantown yesterday with my girlfriend looking for some cheap/good eats. Came across this little gem and stared at the menu out in front for a few minutes. Decided to give it a try, and couldn't have left more satisfied! 2 item bento boxes for under $10, can't beat that price! 

I got the two item bento with teriyaki beef (very tender and full of flavor!) and Takoyaki (5 pieces/very good and the pieces of octopus inside are huge! Definitely one of the best takoyaki I've had.) My girlfriend had the same, but instead of the beef teriyaki, she got the shrimp tempura (two huge pieces!)

The service was awesome as well! The woman who seated us was very kind. A man came out 5 minutes later and took our order (he was also very kind and humorous, lol.) He recommended the best selling roll (Volcano roll), which was honestly one of the best rolls I've had in a while! (and I eat a lot of sushi.)

We decided to keep a menu, just in case we wanted more food. The man suggested the sushi burrito's. We definitely would have tried one or two, but unfortunately we were way too stuffed from our bento's + the massive roll.

The atmosphere is a little dim, but very relaxing. 

------

Pros: Cheap prices, good food, excellent service! 

Cons: Service was a little slow(15-20min. wait), but the food was really good so that made up for it, lol.


I will definitely be coming back
author: The Honest Yelper D.

description: Came here for dinner one night and it was decent. It was an alright place. I don't love it and I don't hate it food wise The service was really bad though. It took forever to get a waiter's attention. They seriously never made eye contact. We also had to wait for a table so to wait for a table and receive not the best service really brought this place down in my book. The food was good though. I like the food and the sweet sake they had. I'd only come back if someone else really wanted to go, otherwise, this would not be my first choice of sushi places.
author: Julie L.

description: Awesome atmosphere. The waiters are very nice and will tell you exactly what is good. It was like I was a guest in their home. The sake was great with more flavor thank typical cheap sake. The bill was affordable, especially for how much food we got. A nice warm place to hang out and stuff your face.
author: Tyler S.

description: Haven't been to the mall in awhile so looked this place up on Yelp. Overall I would say I'm leaving full and happy. We had the sunrise roll and the lion queen roll, a good compliment to each other since one is spicy and the other has a creamy mayo. A little pricey but I understand the city is more expensive. I would say this place is worth a visit if you want casual atmosphere, good sushi, and friendly staff.
author: Laura D.

description:
Sorry yelpers...off on this one.

Crazy busy, mediocre food....and cheated on check.  Called them out on it and waited 20 minutes for corrected bill.

Sushi: not completly fresh and so so
Tempura: a bit on the greasy side
Yakatori:  had a good sauce on it
Soba:  did not seem fresh or home made 

Pluses:  did not mind kids
author: Nene R.

description: After getting off at SFO, we needed a place to lunch that was in Japantown, near our apartment. The food is pretty good and the service is okay and there was no wait when we went for lunch. Just based on the food and experience, I'd probably give three stars. (The food tasted more like Chinese folks making Japanese food than authentic Japanese food.) But, there is a crazy two-item special for $9.49 that brings this up to four stars. If you're in Japantown and looking for some lunch food, this is a good spot.
author: Judy S.

description:
Got the black garlic ramen and it was just average.

The unagi don was delicious though, with very tasty grilled eel.
author: Victoria S.

description:
Kui Shin Bo has fresh, relatively cheap food in large portions served by a friendly staff.  Wait can get long but it's worth it, just be sure to signup as soon as you get there. Reservation process is usually a dodgy little notepad hanging on the post just outside. 

It's a low key, casual atmosphere.  I live around the area, taken my rounds to other venues, nothing beat this place.  Me and the roommates usually catch dinner here just before we go out on the town, strikeout, go home alone, and contemplate why we pay a billion dollars a month in rent.

5/5 chill af resturaunt.
author: Lorenzo C.

description:
Casual place. Great sushi, Smooth sake. Had a good time.
Time to get seated was a bit long but expected.
author: Harry A.

description:
AMAZING SUSHI. The raw fish was super fresh and the special rolls are huge! I will definitely be coming here again.

Docked one star because it took a while to get our food, which made us late for our movie... but all waiters were extremely friendly. :)
author: Jessy R.

description:
Not sure why I have yet to write a review for this place. I come here every week religiously. 

The owners are a lovely couple who always remember my order by heart, and do their best to accommodate all customers swiftly during rush hour. The food is great (they have my favorite tempura batter in the city,) the food always comes out fast and the prices are excellent.

This is the perfect place to stop by if visiting Japantown, or even if you're like me and you have a million things to do in one day and have to eat quickly between work and errands. Whether you want to stay and sit a spell with friends or just get in, get good food, and get out, this is a fantastic restaurant for your next Japanese food fix.
author: Sydney Y.

description: I went to San Francisco from Fresno to Lyft all weekend up there and make some cash, see the sights, eat some food, have a little vacation that paid for itself.  I'm from the midwest and I love sushi.  Problem is, it takes a lot longer for the fish to get to your plate and of course its expensive compared to coastal areas who aren't burdened with importing.  I noticed a significant increase in the quality of sushi I was getting in Fresno compared to St. Louis (I assume this is because it spends less time on a truck), so out of curiosity I googled which city had the best rated sushi in the US with a strong hunch already as to who it was.  I wasn't surprised at all that it seems pretty across the board that San Francisco is the best sushi city.  I knew I had to have sushi there when I could so on this trip I got on Yelp and looked around.  I was on a budget so I looked for the lowest price, highest rated and ended up here.  I got there a couple minutes before opening and they welcomed me and I sat down in the corner.  They were very friendly, didn't have the thai tea I'm used to having with my sushi in the midwest and fresno, probably cause they stick with Japanese only stuff, which is cool with me.  I got the hot tea they had instead (don't remember which one), which was great.  Had a strong sesame like flavor in there that I really liked.  Dude kept coming by and refilling it before I could ever finish a cup off.  That's my favorite thing anybody that serves me can do, keep my drink from going empty.  I ordered the assorted sushi which was reasonably priced, and even at expensive sushi joints (especially at expensive sushi joints), I prefer the classics.  Rolls are a whole lot of flash to me.  Nigiri, fish on rice, is my shit.  It came with a basic cucumber and tuna roll with 6 pieces of nigiri.  I mean, I'm sure there's probably better sushi places in SF if you wanna pay more, but it sure as hell was the best sushi I've ever ate so far.  That in combination with amazing service and a reasonable price gets this place a 5 from me.  The fish was so fresh, I've never experienced it like that before.  The  himachi (yellowtail) was so fresh it didn't have that super fishy taste that never bothered me, but my wife hates.  None of the fish did.  Its like that fish died the day before or that morning or something.  Thanks for that experience guys, really appreciated it.
author: Dane N.

description:
It's been a while. I think I kind of just gave up. Don't get me wrong, I love writing reviews but for a little time period, I just gave up on... everything.

Anyways that's a moot point now, today I'm here to write about Kui Shin Bo. 

A little backstory. I find a lot of restaurants in Japan town underwhelming. Especially the handful I've tried so I just stopped going. However one of my good friends had the opportunity to try this establishment with his lady and he swore by this place. I tried about 5 times on separate occasions to patron this place but it was always closed.

I almost gave up until my friend was like, 'let's try to go today' and it was opened.

We were promptly greeted and shown a table, it's a fairly small establishment so the owner (I'm guessing) can easily see what is going on. There is a special's white board that had a handful of items and menus with sushi, and entrees. My friend has been there like 4 million times since he discovered it and knows the owner very well and always orders the same thing, while I perused the menu for sushi as he swore by it.

First time we went, he ordered the special with vegetable curry and chicken katsu. I ordered:

Amaebi
Hotate
Sake (salmon) nigri
Unagi Nigri
Special Dragon Roll
Baked Salmon Roll

I can see why their ratings are a bit low, they sell sushi but their strong point isn't sushi. The amaebi was good, and the fried head was battered and fried wonderfully. The Hotate, and Sake was nothing special. The Dragon roll had a very nicely fried tempura shrimp inside, other than that it was alright. And the baked salmon roll (probably a lion king) was questionable since there was flour on top. For some reason their rice, it doesn't taste right for sushi rice, it's cold, and a bit difficult to eat.

'But you gave them 4 stars, why?'

The service rocks!

No just kidding. I don't like rating an establishment based on service. I mean I would like to point out their service rocks, but the 4 stars is for their specials/entrees. 

I tried my friend's chicken katsu and it was wonderful. Like only a handful of places wins my love for their chicken katsu and this place hands down is the best. Crispy panko fried with juicy non-chewy flavorful interior. Heck you don't even need the katsu sauce but it's available.

We left after that, and I had a weird craving for it again so we came back a week later.

I ordered the special with chicken katsu and beef teriyaki, amebi, and red dragon roll and my friend ordered the vegetable curry along with the shrimp tempura. 

Again, the sushi is not their strong point. It was fresh amaebi, and the fried head was again wonderful, but the rice, it needs work.

But the real winner is their fried foods. One of the best chicken katsu I've ever tasted, coupled with tender and juicy beef teriyaki. Simply delicious. I stole a piece of my friend's shrimp tempura and it was wonderful, batter was crispy, not soggy, shrimp is firm and fresh.

Their strongest suit is their frying technique. I don't know how they do it but it's consistent and it's delicious. If it doesn't taste right, then the chef that usually fries the food is not there.

I don't know what has come before me, a small dinky hole in the wall that is super affordable and all I want is to go back and have their chicken katsu and whatever fried foods they still have.

Cheers!
author: Harry P.

description:
What a great deal. For 9.99$, for lunch or dinner, you get to choose two items from the white board such as california rolls, chicken katsu, chicken and beef teriyaki, many other japanese dishes + you get rice, miso soup and salad.
You'll be definitely pretty full at the end of the meal!
The manager who welcomed us was super friendly and smiley. Once we had ordered, we waited about 15 minutes for the food.

I had the beef teriyaki and the california roll, the beef was tender and the sauce was yummy! Could tell the california rolls were just made.

This place is cool if you want a bento of various japanese dishes.
author: Leslie S.

description: I don't understand why this place has so many good reviews. Tempura was way over a battered. Teriyaki sauce tasted weird. I would not come back here even for the price.
author: C t.

description: Went for my daughters 13th Birthday, and had a wonderful experience! Seated right away very friendly service! We were a party of 6 people and all had something different. From Sushi Rolls to Raman Bowls (Hey... that rymes!) Very Good! We were served, ate, and were out in good time to make our show! We will be back!
author: John O.

description: This place is busy for a reason , the food is awesome I love there ramen the broth is so good. Get here early if you can , they close at 830 but we waited till 9 and were there till about 10 (we were last on the waiting list)
author: christopher g.

description:
Miyako Mall is the forgotten building of Japan Center. OK, maybe it's just me...unless I'm in a dollar-store mood at Ichiban Kan or Daiso. But eat here? Fuggedaboutit. However, Lady Fate twisted her knife in my belly last Saturday when the Sundance Kabuki had some technical fiasco and canceled the 3PM showing of "Zero Dark Thirty". Bummer. And 2-1/2 hours to burn. While casually strolling among my peeps, I noticed Kui Shin Bo out of the corner of my squinty eye. I took a quick look at the Yelp app to see if I was about to make the second biggest mistake of the day (the first was getting the ticket for the movie).

I entered to find a compact place that doesn't really accommodate solitary diners. No matter since the owner cordially offered me a big table for four since they were only half-full in the middle of the afternoon. Yes, yes, I know they have a $8.50 two-item lunch that judging from other tables, looked like quite a hearty deal. But I was in a mood that only a simmering bowl of ramen noodles could address. So dammit, it better be good here. For $7.99, they offer Raman (sic) Noodles with slices of barbecue pork, fish cake cubes, bean sprouts, onion and a semi-hard-boiled egg (see photo). Not bad, in fact, surprisingly good considering that it's not really a noodle house.

The noodles were al dente, the pork slices big and plentiful, the Chinese cabbage a nice switch, and the broth quite hearty without being too salty. As a side, if you will, I ordered the $5.99 Chicken Wings, five of them which were nicely grilled and quite succulent (see photo). When I squeezed lemon on them, I immediately flashbacked to my childhood when my mom prepared them the same way - light on the salt, heavy on the citrus. So obviously I did not achieve the intended cost efficiency of coming here since I needed my ramen and wings, but it was still a good deal and well worth coming back with Jamie W. who is always looking for a dependable good deal.

FOOD - 4 stars...surprisingly good items in a place that initially felt so predictable
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...tiny place made for larger parties mostly
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...owner was quite accommodating
TOTAL - 4 stars...coming back and not because I need some Pockys from Ichiban Kan
author: Ed U.

description: Love this place! Tiny hole-in-the-wall upstairs in Japantown with maybe 10 tables, if you come in expecting "cheap, good food" you won't be disappointed. Dollar-for-dollar, best sushi I've found in the area (esp when you consider nearby Pac Heights' lackluster sushi options), waitstaff is awesome and I find myself going there once a week. Also love the fact they have a pretty deep menu selection -- ramen, sushi, udon, teriyaki, etc etc -- they have it all. Saturday night can get a bit crazy, but any other night the wait is ~5-10 minutes at worst.
author: Teo D.

description: My favorite spot for ramen. Love the Mad Spicy Ramen! Service is great and the tiny restaurant is cute and cozy.
author: Sophie H.

description:
Glad I came to this tiny restaurant . I was looking for non americanized Japanese food and found it.

Chicken and beef teriyaki were tender and juicy. All other meals were good too. Egg garlic ramen was perfectly cooked. Im in love with this place
author: Olga C.

description:
The sushi was decent and the prices were comparable to the sushi establishments found in Houston. 

I didn't think the sushi was out of this world - they were delicious, yes, but I feel like I could have found similar pieces with same tastes in Houston too for cheaper prices. The rolls were well-packed and portions were huge. We only spent $70 for 4 people and this includes 4 big rolls, 1 sushi burrito, and 2 lunch specials! The lunch specials were a good deal - you pick 2 meal options for the total price of $9.95. If it's a meal that does not have a soup base, it also comes with soup, rice, and veggies! 

I have to give two thumbs up for the service. The owners / waitstaff actually walk over to personally advise us on how to eat certain meals. For example, we ordered this dish composed of a fried fish and several sauces. They came up to us and showed us that the best way to eat this meal would be to slather rice over it and pour the sauce on top of that. It definitely tastes a whole lot better than eating the fish by itself.  

For them to take the time to show us how to correctly eat the meal to get the best out of our dining experience was going above and beyond! I have never had someone teach me how to eat something that would be more culturally-appropriate at an affordable restaurant. 

Food was decent, but the service here more than made up for it! This was also one of the cheaper sushi restaurants with high ratings in that area of San Francisco. I would highly recommend this place for a good, affordable meal and homey service.

They were also extremely patient and took the time to recommend food that fit our needs. My relative could not speak English and we had to translate back and forth between Japanese - English - Chinese. The waitress was super understanding and took the time to explain to us what each dish was and made sure to confirm our orders back to us since we kept changing them. Thank you so much!!!
author: Mugusta S.

description:
$10 for a combo in Japantown? What a steal!

I stumbled upon this place the weekend of the Cherry Blossom Festival and I'm so glad I did! The festival has food vendors, but it was just too crowded that my family and I just wanted to sit down and enjoy our lunch. 

By the looks of other Yelp reviews, the combo was once $8.99. I'm not sure if the price went up, because it was a Festival weekend or if $9.99 is the new price. Regardless, it's still a great deal! 

Food: Great quality and a bang for your buck. Ku Shin Bo doesn't skimp on the servings. 

Service: VERY good! I liked how the waiter explained the proper way in eating traditional dishes. For instance, when he served my order, cold Soba, he mentioned there is a broth that I must dip my noodles in, rather than pour the broth over the noodles. I was really impressed that he took the time to mention it to me. My lunch experience went from 3 stars to 4 with this simple tip. 

Overall, it was a delightful, pleasant, and tasty lunch. I definitely felt like I immersed myself in the culture by food! 

The only gripe I have is that another server came by with another order and totally grazed his big shirt against my meal as he outstretched his arms to place the tray on the other side of the table.
author: Briana H.

description: The sushi was great, the rice was perfect and the fish was really fresh. I highly recommend the takoyaki. Now if you like quality over quantity, you'll love this place. They also offer two dishes for 10.99 so it's a really good deal, I consider this one restaurant as one of those hidden gems that are hidden all over SF.
author: Anuhar A.

description: Casual, easy to pop in delightful Sushi spot in Japan town. Sashimi platter and the "Philadelphia Roll" were highlights. Tasy and good portions.
author: Dani C.

description: The sushi is decent. The best thing to order = cucumber sashimi rolls. They are without a doubt the best item on the menu.
author: Amaya A.

description: The restaurant is located on the second floor of the East Mall in Japantown. Menu looked good so in we go. A gentleman welcomes us in and offers the lunch specials. He was courteous and friendly. We ordered Dragon, Rainbow and Unagi sushi - all were very good. We also had the Nabeyaki Udon and Ramen. Both were delicious and portion size was large (good for 2 people). We also tried their lunch special - combination of two items served bento style with miso soup, salad and white rice. The batter on the Shrimp Tempura was a bit much for me, but the dish comes with two pieces of shrimp, carrot, broccoli and lotus root. The Agedashi Tofu was really good. All this for $8.95. What a deal.
author: Arleen E.

description:
I love this place!  I stopped in 2pm middle of the week for a really late lunch. I totally think this place deserves a 5 stars!!!

The food is totally awesome.  Just the way I imagined. I ordered unagi over rice. First of all the food came out quite fast, maybe a 5 min wait. The unagi was cooked perfect.  Tender bites with hint of sweetness. The sesame adds the perfect nuttiness and a hint of crunch. So wonderful. All the food was steaming hot... In a raining day as it was... the perfect meal to cozy me up. 

I will for sure come back any chance I get!
author: Ling G.

description: Whenever we go to Japantown, this is the only pace we get our Japanese food fix.  We have been coming here for years. When we first started to come here, we walked in and immediately got seated.  Within the last two years, the place is packed and there is a wait. No biggie, because the food and the service is awesome!  Located nbext to Ichi Ban Kan, the place is small, but it is worth the wait.  Their bento specials where you get to choose two items come with salad and miso soup is under $10! Can't beat that price!
author: Carry O.

description: Had pink lady and few nigiri delivered and oh gosh. I would never order food from here ever again. Tuna was really dry and so thin that i couldn't taste anything. Not worth the money for sure...
author: Sm Y.

description:
Went to eat here on a Wednesday with my boyfriend for lunch and it was an overall great experience. We ordered two bento boxes which was only $9.49 each - you get to choose two options of your choice & it comes with rice, soup & salad. The owner took our order & he recommended the Volcano roll so we ordered that as well. Great customer service!

Bento box #1 - was with Takoyaki & beef teriyaki. The Takoyaki (5pcs) was great! It was a good size & was filled with big pieces of octopus which is a plus bc most places that sell these barely have any in them. It also came with a bottle of BBQ sauce just in case you needed more of it! The beef teriyaki was also great, the beef tasted fresh & the teriyaki sauce was bomb! I kept scooping it onto my rice. 

Bento #2 - was also with Takoyaki & fried shrimp tempura. The shrimp tempura (2pcs) was fried to a crisp & was hot when it came out. The miso soup came in a soup bowl with a lid, it was so cute! 

Volcano Roll - Honestly, one of the best rolls I've tried! It consists of shrimp tempura, tuna, salmon, snow crab, masago, avocado, cucumber, spicy mayo & kabayaki sauce! The shrimp tempura gave it a nice crunch & it was topped off with real crab meat. Ugh, you have to try it! Definitely coming again!
author: Brenda R.

description: New favorite in Japantown. The caterpillar roll was fantastic. Everything very fresh & clean, and the server was super patient with my non-sushi/non-fish eating companion.
author: Donna K.

description: The food wasn't bad, but the wait was atrocious. The sushi came an hour after we ordered! We were starving and really considered leaving. Couldn't really enjoy the food when we were pretty upset about the wait.
author: Lucy T.

description:
Seriously the best deal in Japantown. For $8.99 you can choose two items plus rice, miso, and salad. I ordered Chicken Katsu and CA roll while my sister ordered the Ramen and Tonkatsu. We also added a side of Takoyaki ($4.50).

The Katsus were fried to perfection, nice and juicy on the inside and surprisingly thick unlike other places that are mostly breading and no meat. CA roll was decent. Sister said Ramen was simple but good. Takoyaki came out hot, crispy and satisfying. 

I'd say 3 stars for the food and an extra star for the service. The man who helped us was so wonderful. Come here next time you're in the area. This little shop needs some love!
author: Jenny Y.

description:
so disappointing. 

Had high hopes based on other reviews but was let down. Service is SO slow, took an hour for two of us to get udon soup and chicken teriyaki with miso soup and salad. Btw, the chicken teriyaki was defrosted frozen chicken slathered in mediocre tasting teriyaki sauce. 

Sushi looked good but I won't be back to try it. With so many other similar places around, try somewhere else.
author: Sarah G.

description:
I was disappointed with the sashimi.  Very thin cuts.  3 pieces of their sashimi put together is my normal one piece, however, it is very fresh.  My husband ordered their 2 items for $8.99, deep fried oysters (4 pcs) and Saba shio (grilled salted mackerel).  Both were very good.  Came with miso soup and rice. For my nieces' 2 items, she got udon and agedashi. The broth looked like water with pieces of seaweed thrown in there. I didn't taste it but niece said it was good.  Their caterpillar roll was decent. 

I was disappointed that they didn't have uni and no wine.  Although the cooked items were good and the price is right, I need good sushi to come back.
author: The Q.

description: WOW this is like a hidden gem in Japantown. My friend got the daily deal for $10 bucks -- a huge plate of curry rice, lots of tonkatsu, miso soup, and some salad. Boy I wish I got that -- and I will, next time, but my udon was amazing as well. Broth was not thick and very drinkable. Will be back!
author: Justin S.

description: Excellent service and food! Small, but cozy; authentic Japanese; incredibly large menu!
author: Laura H.

description: Loved this place so much that I ate there twice during my weekend in San Fran. If you have ever been to an Izakaiya in Osaka then this is the food you will find there. Simple. Hearty. Delicious. And a bargain. I loved everything I ordered here.
author: Jay F.

description:
I was visiting with my sister in Japan town and we wanted to find some good eats. We saw the review on yelp and were curious about the establishment. 
Like the pictures, the shop looked like a hole in the wall store you would find in Japan. The wait was a bit long, but understandable due to its popularity.
The food was really good! The portions were great as well, matching the price . My sister ordered the pick two option - curry rice with vegetable tenpura - and I ordered the oyako don (chicken and egg over rice). The curry rice was surprisingly spicy, but overall well done. 
Since the store was busy, the service was so-so.
author: Shelley C.

description:
Nothing spectacular but nothing to sneeze at either. Portions were generous for the price. 4-piece Agedashi tofu appetizer, 12-piece sake sashimi plate, spicy tender beef curry rice plate (came with miso soup and salad), 2-piece inari, and 2 hot sakes came out to under $40.  

The spicy tender beef curry rice was good but not what I was really craving for.  As ridiculous as this might sound--I was actually craving for the typical curry rice that comes out of the box packages but with fresh veggies and sliced beef which is how the restaurant across the way (Mifune Don) usually serves it up.  However, last time i was at Mifune Don, I got the instant runs (sorry, TMI) after I ate a curry rice plate so I opted to try Kui Shin Bo instead.  So instead of the typical box curry, the fatty beef found in this curry rice comes in chunks that's been stewed for a while so it is indeed tender.  I also asked for it to be mild but it was still very spicy.  

The wait was not too bad for dinner time on a Saturday night.  The place is small and at 6:30 PM, we waited about 15 minutes to be seated.  

All in all, I would come back if it is convenient and there's no long wait but I would not go out of my way to eat here especially since they're not one of the establishments that validate parking.
author: Ivy Z.

description: This review is based solely on service. I came for dinner by myself and the restaurant was not so busy at the time (5:30pm) and for some reason it still took me 45 minutes to get my food. Why!? I just had one sushi roll and a miso soup.
author: Toro C.

description: This really is pretty cool because the owner is the waiter. Of course I got fantastic services both times I've eaten here. They have a very affordable special lunch menu that you just cannot find in Japan town. You get to pick 2 items off a list for just 8.99. I got the ramen and California rolls which was very good. Note you can only pick 1 main item and the 2nd item has to be more appetizer. Just like what I had. This restaurant is clean and pretty small. The service is good. I came back because not only did I like the food but the owner was very friendly.
author: Samantha P.

description:
Don't really know what Yelper Hai Q is talking about. 

Me and my mom visited this place after my weekly 3.1miles race in SF. We arrived around 11:05am, but realized the restaurant is not open until 11:30am. However, the owners were nice to let us go in around 11:25am. As soon as we sat down, the owner recommended to us the lunch special. You can choose any 2 options from the board where it also comes with rice, miso soup and salad. The male owner was nice and helpful. I ordered the shrimp tempura and chicken katsu, thr tempura was probably the best I had in SF. Crispy and delicious. We also tried the fish, which was tasty as well. The restaurant was quickly filled up with patrons and it was full by mid-day. Green tea is conplimentary and restaurant is clean, definitely will visit again!
author: Cheng L.

description: This is really good informal type of Japanese food. It's not in a bad way though, they have a large selection and super crispy tempura. It's really cozy and staff is so friendly!!! They made such good recommendations and portions were perfect. This will definitely stay on my list as a go to spot in Japantown : )
author: Lauren H.

description: Not an authentic Japanese restaurant - no one dining or working here is Japanese. Quality of ingredients are below average. I ordered the nabeyaki udon. The broth was okay but the ingredients were lackluster at best. Shrimp tempura was very heavily breaded. Had 4 fish cakes which I felt just took up space. Otherwise just filled with cabbage and wakame.
author: Sophia S.

description: This is the best spot in J town for Japanese food, whether you're looking for authentic or fusion. The first time might be a little weird because of the huge menu, but after having the chicken soba, the grilled saba and many rolls on separate occasions, it's all good. The staff are friendly, tables are clean, and the food is consistently on point. Tip big because the prices are a bargain compared to the other places in the area.
author: Soi L.

description:
My boyfriend had a workshop in San Francisco for a week and we stayed in Japantown at Hotel Kabuki. In my search for food around town, Kui Shin Bo was one of the places that caught my eye - and I must say, I'm glad it did! It's a small shop with only a couple of seats and it is very popular. This is seriously the BEST sushi we have ever had. And the menu is huge! They had sushi, ramen, hot pot, sushi-sized burritos, different types of katsu, curry, tempura, and more!

We ate there twice during our stay. The first time we went, we had the takoyaki, volcano roll, and the rock n' roll. The second time we went I had the fish katsu and shrimp tempura and my boyfriend had the spicy crunchy tuna roll. Everything was very very good! I highly recommend if you're ever in Japantown!
author: Sheila L.

description:
The service is great; the owners were very kind and attentive. Food was great! Prices are very reasonable for the amount of food. We all ordered dinner combos; you can choose 2 main items and then also receive rice, soup and salad all for $9.99!! The sashimi cucumber roll was "refreshingly delicious" (as stated by my father) :) 

Do yourself a favor and stop by for dinner!! You won't be disappointed.
author: Devan C.

description: This is a very cozy, warm family-owned restaurant. The sushi is fresh, and the food is classic and tasty. The menu offers a wide selection, so everyone can find something they will like.
author: K T.

description: Nothing special about their food. I went there just because I saw a line there. Food taste boring, really nothing special. No parking garage stamp for customer which is terrible cause I knew other restaurants nearby, at the same building offer it. Oh, well. I need to go back to my regular which is Mifune don across the hall ( food much better ).
author: P S.

description: Enjoyed a tasty, delicious lunch of sushi and sashimi. Menu has a large selection and choices to satisfy most everyone. Highly recommend.
author: Lisa H.

description: They're 2 item for $10 is nice.  Service is nice.  Avoid the ramen.  It's way too salty.
author: John P.

description:
Food is pretty good and the price is definitely one of the cheaper places for Japanese food in SF.  Minus one star because the service is incredibly slow.  Took 35 min for food to come out.

Grilled squid and Saba were excellent!!!
author: Gordon C.

description: Bomb food and cheap relative to the other places around. The two items plus miso, rice, and salad is a good deal! Service is too slow. Long delay to order, get water, and get your food that makes it seem like they forgot about you.
author: Daniel L.

description: Fantastic!  The service was phenomenal.  The waiter made great recommendations as we ordered and everyone working there was helpful and pleasant.  The food was amazing and authentic.  If you're in the area, I would recommend visiting this little gem!
author: Tabitha W.

description: I'm not gonna say that this is the best sushi or Japanese food I've ever had, but for the price, it's a great value. There's a meal option for those on a strict budget that is $9.99 that seems really popular. For those who want to sample something different, there's this great roll that is three kinds of fish (salmon, red tuna, and I want to say albacore tuna) with avocado and it's wrapped in a thin slice of cucumber and comes with a ponzu dipping sauce that is very refreshing and frankly surprisingly innovative for a family-owned joint like this. Don't expect fine dining but for $15-$20/meal, you get solid food.
author: Patricia L.

description: Excellent quality and friendly service. The fish tasted exceptional and was very fresh. Quantity of fish per piece of sashimi or roll could be a little higher, but their prices are competitive and I did not feel they were overcharging. Can't wait to visit again!
author: John M.

description:
Was here for a conference at the Kabuki Hotel up the street and decided on Kui Shin Bo during our lunch break. 

Decor/Ambiance: This place is a little hard to find, but it's in the Japan Town Center on the second floor in a corner. It's a small restaurant with traditional Japanese decor. 

Food: I was dining alone and ordered one dragon style roll and some miso soup. I was very pleased with the quality of the roll. Everything was fresh and I remember not feeling weighed down by heavy ingredients. I also really enjoyed the miso soup -- always do. 

Service: Service was great! I showed up and was told it would be about a 30 minute wait. There's a little bench not too far from the restaurant where I waited. In about 20 minutes, they were ready for me. My waiter promptly attended to me and answered the questions I had about the menu and shared some recommendations as well. He also provided sriracha sauce to accompany my sushi - a must! I truly don't understand the Japanese restaurants that do not have sriracha in stock smh. 

Overall: 4 stars. Would definitely return if I find myself in JapanTown.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
I was surprised to see it was somewhat crowded on a weekday, so I took a look at their menu and we decided to eat here. Prices are decent, especially being located in Japantown. 

I ordered the 2 item bento box - $9.49. You get to choose any two items from a 20+ item list. I ordered the chicken teriyaki and vegetable tempura. It comes with rice, miso soup, and salad. I felt that the chicken teriyaki was very bland. I could tell it was not marinated long or well enough. The sauce over the chicken did not add any flavor. I felt like I was just eating plain white chicken meat. The vegetable tempura was good. There was a variety of vegetables - pumpkin, broccoli, zucchini, string beans, sweet potato, and carrot. 
 
The service here is great!
author: Kimberly H.

description:
So this is not 4- start worthy as it currently seems to be rated around here. We came because it's cheap and had great reviews. However, the sushi nor the ramen is very good, and it's not cheap!! 

If you are willing to pay $15-30 per person, then this is probably not the place you should go. You can get much better quality sushi and ramen elsewhere in SF, not a challenge at all. 

Side note, be prepared to organize the line of people waiting outside (who are also fooled by the current rating!). I had to get a piece of paper and take people's names down to create a wait list....

Also, service is  s l o w.
author: Simona A.

description: Sushi was very delicious and high quality especially for the prices they charge. Sushi burrito nothing to write home about. About 40-50% cheaper than any other sushi place in SF that provides comparative quality and portions. Very glad to have discovered this hole-in-the-wall gem! Will be back to try the ramen !
author: Talya R.

description:
Food is cheaper, service is fast and without smile. 

The sashimi cut was terrible.  The chef must have not been trained how to properly do a clean cut. The meat was in pieces. 

Katsu was over fried, very dry inside. 

Every piece of sushi roll varies in shapes and heights.  

Even some food trucks do a better job than this restaurant.  Oh, and be aware, none of the owner and servers are Japanese.  

One of the lady servers were very impatient with our table last night.  After we asked her for plates twice(our food is out, but no plates to eat with), she told us :"I will get you plates, don't worry!"  Really?
author: Wen H.

description: Stumbled upon this restaurant after looking for the now closed Ramen Underground. Looking for some good veggie alternatives on the menu, Kui Shin Bo had lots of choices and a $10 multi-selection special. I'm telling you, I have had a lot of tofu in my day and the Tofu Agedashi was over the top amazing. Sushi was excellent, too. It's on the quieter side of Japantown, nice management, as well.
author: Aquableu C.

description:
$9 for a bento box special? You really can't pass that kind of deal up. That just screams bargain to me, especially in the high priced Japantown area. You get what you pay for here though, and the food was pretty iffy. 

I got their shrimp tempura and the California roll. The tempura was undercooked. The outside was all crisp like tempura should be, but the inside was just raw breading. California roll was pretty good, but it's kind of hard to mess those up. My friend got their pork ramen, and she said it was like cup of noodles just with slices of pork and cabbage. She also didn't receive her rice and salad and miso soup that she was supposed to. 

Service was super nice, and it's totally a family owned business which is why I feel a little bad about leaving a bad review, but this place just wasn't good at all. It's nice if you're on a budget, but I'd rather pay a little more for something tastier! Much better options in Japantown are around.
author: Sean H.

description: Great inexpensive Japanese place. Their nigiri have very large pieces of rice but also generous portions of the fish. Also plenty of lunch specials to choose from
author: Leo C.

description: We were visiting from central Oregon and I wanted my son to experience good sushi without breaking the bank, this place is perfect.  We got the nigiri sampler and a specialty roll, plus ramen.  The fish was unbelievably fresh, the portions were huge, price was less then I would have expected, so low key and unassuming.  Our waiter was kind and helpful.  If only we could access sushi like this in the middle of Oregon!  I will always return here when visiting.
author: Josh W.

description: Super nice servers that are willing to patiently explain each item on the menu you may have questions about! The $9.49 2-item bento is a great deal and I always get the Garlic Egg Noodles with Vegetable Croquette on the side. The wait is a bit long but it's not a problem for me since the food is amazing!! Everything comes out fresh, the croquette is crispy and the noodles are so flavorful and do not stick.
author: Erica S.

description:
Our family come to this cozy restaurant, it has lunch special, two items with miso soup and salad and rice. We ordered the Saba shio and beef teriyaki,  kushi tatsu, ramen etc, it is sooo good. And my wife ordered a second order of Saba shio to satisfy our taste. 

The line a bit long, we wait about 15 minutes, but the good thing is that they are open all day.
author: William T.

description: The food is so good here! My fiancé got the spicy ramen 4 alarm, and it was delicious! I was trying not to eat his food while I waited for my sake ikura don. The salmon was fresh, and the sushi rice was perfect! Would come again next time I'm in SF!
author: Deanna Q.

description:
Best tasting teriyaki sauce that I've had so far. I also tried their shrimp tempura and it was crispy, but the batter was slightly bland. I believe they did that on purpose because the tempura sauce was on the salty side. 

I'm rating 4 stars because I really really really enjoyed their beef teriyaki. I've been to different japanese restaurants and their beef teriyaki is the best one, by far. I also tried my s/o's pork katsu and it was perfect. It's not dry like other tonkatsu (yup, not like those cardboard tonkatsu at other places).

The only down side is that service is a little slow. It's great if you're entertaining a friend and want to catch up with them by having long conversations. However, if you're in a hurry you'd have to wave your hands repeatedly and hope that they notice you.

Overall, this is a great restaurant. It's one of my hidden gems of japantown and I hope that they continue to strive for greatness.
author: Andreau L.

description:
Very mediocre Japanese food. Probably oriented towards tourists that never had Japanese food. 

Long wait. One very slow poorly trained Sushi chef cannot keep up with clients demands. The miso soup has no flavor. The price is reasonable but it does not matter, it is not worth it.
author: Shoco M.

description: We had a bento lunch here. We were expecting that this store in San Francisco had much better Japanese bento than the stores where we usually go. First of all, they had tiny portion. I'm an Asian, I don't need big portion but the bento they served here wasn't enough for me. Secondly, they were way expensive. Totally disappointed. We'd rather go our usual Japanese store to have bento than coming here. Or maybe just bento wasn't good in this store.
author: Capnodium C.

description: Wow! I never write reviews but honestly the server lady refused to answer my questions about the menu. She said she was too busy for a few questions. She told me its all in the menu. So I have to look through the 8 page menu to find out what everything is? I walked out right away. How rude!
author: Aryanna H.

description:
Price is cheap and potion size is good.
However, the taste is not. The tempura is not steamed to soft before frying. The miso soup was too salty.
author: andy s.

description: Came to San Fran on a business trip and wanted something fresh, affordable and quick. This place nailed all three. Only ordered sushi (eel, salmon, white tuna [amazeballs!], sea urchin, and scallop) but everything was savory and delicious. I'm a sushi snob and was very satisfied. Nice sized pieces too. Service is very friendly. Atmosphere not so much, but it's Japantown which has a charm all its own.
author: SA F.

description:
Awesome food. Service is so-so but not bad.
Recommend coming as a couple or you may get turned away!
author: Brandon H.

description: Great little place tucked away in the corner of the mall. Unbeatable prices and quality fish! Very satisfied, The restaurant was crowded because the food was very good so the service was a bit of a wait but worth it. Everything we order was very good and and served quickly. The terriyaki was tender and large portions also. The nigiri was fresh and large pieces of fish, a great meal!
author: Lonnie S.

description: Love this cute little restaurant in Japantown. We came for lunch and they hand the best specials. 2 entree with miso soup, salad and rice for $10. Everything in the menu is great and is made fresh!
author: Kizna L.

description: Decent food, nothing special. Feels a little prepackaged. Ramen is a touch above average. Good prices though, nice environment, and very nice people.
author: Alexander V.

description: Never been to Japantown and my son wanted to eat Sushi.  We Yelp this restaurant and decided to try it. We made it before the lunch rush. The owner recommended the most popular sushi, The Volcano role and other ones. The fish was so fresh and buttery that it just melts in your mouth.  By far, this was the best sushi restaurant we've been to in the city. Definitely coming back here again.
author: Jackie N.

description: Great sushi and friendly staff! Had a bit of trouble finding the place. If you need help, its in the East Plaza on the second floor.
author: Christina C.

description:
good prices for great food!
nakiyobi odon is amazing. $9
volcano roll is also delish. $13
I got the spicy beef ramen in B Spicyness which was very tasty but beef was a bit tough.. $9
the atmosphere is small and dark which makes it kind of quiet
service is normal
tip: put your name down on the waiting list outside their door: usually there would be 2 or 3 parties ahead of you so prepare to wait a little
author: Alexis S.

description: This place is okay. I got the lunch special with tonkatsu and garlic egg noodles. The lunch special usually comes with miso soup, rice, and salad. Tonkatsu is good but garlic egg noodles were just alright, a little bland. Also if you get the noodles they don't give you rice (I did not know this beforehand so I was a little upset), probably because the noodles were larger portion than the other dishes. My boyfriend got the chicken teriyaki as one of his sides and it was a very small portion. Overall the portion of the dishes were reflective of the price, and the food is just alright.
author: Beth H.

description: Great sushi rolls (volcano, salmon family), sashimi and ramen nodles, excellent value and price. Sushi was very tasty, service was great. Well worth the wait, we came here on New Years day and got in just before they closed. Will absolutely be back next time we visit San Francisco.
author: Jerry C.

description: Got the two items combo: katsu and curry with rice. The katsu was crispy on the outside and tender in the inside. One of the best I've had in Japantown for a while. The curry was flavorful, and with a healthy dash of chili powder, even better. The combo came with miso soup and salad - nothing to write home about. Overall, a very satisfying meal.
author: C C.

description: I've been here twice! Hands down, best sushi I've had in San Francisco. I got the volcano roll and the shrimp tempura roll. First time I went (early on a Saturday evening) and they let me order to go and even gave me a glass of water and let me sit at the sushi bar while I waited. The second time I went (also early on a Saturday evening) they told me they weren't doing take out tonight. I was confused and sad. If I had the time to dine in I would have. Wish take out was more consistent but the food was amazing.
author: McKenzie D.

description:
I've been here twice. It's high quality and inexpensive. Staff is very nice. 

It's on the second floor of a mall. If you're cool with that, definitely come here.
author: Karl R.

description: Not the best food ever,but for the price you get a decent, satisfying meal. I always come here when I'm craving for Japanese food but don't want a hole in my wallet. For lunch they offer a combo of two dishes for 9.49 (comes with miso soup and salad). You WILL leave with a full stomach if you come here!
author: Sui N.

description: I tried this because of the Yelp reviews.  Service was good.  Food was ok.  I had the lunch special with veggie tempura and beef teriyaki.   The veggie was not tender. And the beef was a little chewy.  Maybe because it was 3pm and the beef was cooked earlier.   I didn't try the sushi.
author: Kat W.

description: My Italian parents were visiting me from New Jersey and after our outing to Chrissy Field, they felt adventerous and took my advice to try sushi for the first time in their lives!!  Everything we ordered was outstanding!  A++!  Thank you Kui Shin Bo for making their first experience a delicious memory they will always remember!
author: Guy G.

description: Surprisingly GOOD!  I was a skeptic because the prices were so low, but I was surprised!  The only thing of course is that this place is super popular so expect to wait a bit.
author: Mike B.

description:
Food:  We ordered the lunch speical - I got the ramen and salmon sushi.  My gf ordered the veggie curry, fried chicken wings and fried oysters.  (Hmmm, lot's of fried food you ordered) ... anyways, I thought the food was pretty standard.  Their salmon was not the freshest as my only negative comment.

Food rating:  3/5

Service:  Service was decent.  Our waiter was friendly.

Service rating:  3.5/5

Price:  The lunch speical I think was very reasonable - $9+

Overall:  This was my first place to eat on my SF trip.  I think the food was alright but the area is a cool place to check out which is why we ate here.
author: Elvin W.

description:
This place has SO much potential.

Atmosphere: low, unromantic lighting, decor from the 80's, menus are ripping, music is eerie

The waiter was the sweetest man and the portions are quite large for what you get. 

They have lots of options on the menu, but everything in here is really outdated.  The service was superb and the tea was really tasty, but that's about it.

Hopefully J-town can give them some funding to revive the look and feel.
author: Michelle W.

description:
It was a Saturday, afternoon 3PM, and the restaurant we were planning to go was closed so we passed by this place which was next door. I was instantly aroused by their daily bento special which you pick 2 items for $8.50 and there were a lot of choices to choose from.

There was only 1 table left so my boyfriend and I sat down and AH! their chairs are so short and it was very uncomfortable to sit in after awhile, they should add a pillow on the chair's. At least my feet and my boyfriend's feet touched the floor, because we're short :P The inside of this place is a bit dim, there was a lot of people so it was nice to hear people talk and watch hot plates and bento boxes come out from the kitchen.

Our waiter, some older Asian man with glasses, was very friendly and seemed like your typical older Asian dad. I ordered their daily special bento: veggie tempura and california roll which came with soup, salad and rice. My boyfriend ordered their dragon roll, shrimp tempura and udon. I was sad that they didn't give me my soup and salad UNTIL my food came because I'm used to having my soup's and salad's before I get my food so I could have something to munch on. 
:(

It was super busy when we were there so our food took awhile but it was worth it at the end.


Veggie Tempura: small pieces, but tasted good. 
Cali roll: decent size, delicious.
Soup & Salad: soup was good, I'm not a fan of miso soup in the first place so I gave it to my boyfriend. The salad portion was small, good tasty sauce on top though.
Rice: a little on the dry side.

Dragon Roll: LOOKS like a caterpillar roll, tasted delicious, sorta small portion. But not bad for $8.
Shrimp Tempura: crunchy, a little too much batter, big long pieces.
Udon: tasty!


I really like this place. I need to come back again and finally get the takoyaki !
author: Grace Anne D.

description: Nice food, Comfortable place and affordable price for young tourist like me. Especially highly recommend you 9.55$ set menus which are offered with rice, salad, and miso.
author: Wooin S.

description: Ordered the chikara sho-yu ramen bowl with rice cake & a side of salmon tamaki roll. Service was extremely efficient, & our server seemed to know exactly when we needed something! It was awesome! The bowl was satisfying, the beef was well cut, the only thing left at the end of my meal was the rice cake which wasn't My favorite. Otherwise the meal was very filling, service was great! They had this one booth that was really awkward, otherwise seating is very tight if you don't have your own booth!
author: Jennifer Z.

description: Ramen is the bomb. Generous portions and thank you! Service was excellent. Love the interior but could use some updates just to make sure everything clean in kitchen? Went at lunch time during weekday and no wait! I will be back and introduce to others.
author: Katrena M.

description: I thought the teriyaki chicken was swimming in the teriyaki. Too much for my taste. The food however was pretty inexpensive, and they have decent lunch specials. I enjoyed their miso soup and the side salad that came with my meal. My boyfriend's shrimp tempura was pretty tasty (and I don't really eat seafood).
author: M W.

description: There are a lot of good sushi places but this one is a step above the rest. The fish is fresh and for someone that likes creative sushi rolls, they offer a wide variety of delicious options. The only thing that I don't like about Kui Shin Bo is that they no longer deliver to North Beach and sometimes are too busy to order take out. I'd LOVE to be able to order their amazing food for delivery once again.
author: Adam S.

description: I wouldn't say that the food here is insanely inexpensive, but you can get the dinner special which could be very well worth the money if you choose wisely (2 items for $9.99) The ramen seemed to be just a notch better than instant, so I was kind of disappointed given that this place is in Japantown. Rolls are inexpensive and are good. (simple rolls are less than $10 while fancier gourmet rolls are under $20)
author: Jellie S.

description:
Walked in for dinner at 8:23 and the guy said they were closed. However, on yelp and online it says they close at 9pm. 

Total disappointment, we were really wanting to try this place out!

Weird location too.. I was turned off by it being in a mall.
author: Diesel H.

description: If I go to the Fillmore, I'll go here first. Budget some extra time. This place isn't a secret, and it is busy. The restaurant is in the mall, on the second floor. Most of the other restaurants around it are graveyards. This place is hopping, and the guy running the show knows his stuff. One guy drinking a few, one guy not. Both stuffed on food. $60 total. That is nuts inexpensive for the good stuff. And it does melt. Great place.
author: NoCal S.

description:
Had some gyoza, katsu ramen, and an udon noodle dish with tempura shrimp - everything was top notch. Very helpful host and staff who can make recommendations. 

The ramen especially stood out, with a creamy sesame flavor and hints of miso and pork. Highly recommended! 

Don't be afraid to put in a little spice!
author: Chris B.

description:
Very slow service at an off hour (3 pm) with no line or crowds. I haven't tried the food here yet but I'm getting hangry sitting here for the past 30 minutes waiting on my two sushi rolls. Very disappointing to someone who was jumping and up and down in excitement after looking at the menu not too long ago. 

Will update review after trying my sushi. It better be good!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Great affordable sushi with friendly staff. Either come here early or expect to wait to be seated.
author: Jake D.

description:
Came here on Christmas day, so it might be a bit busier than usual.

The waiter (maybe owner) is super friendly. However it took a while for the food to come.

My tonkatsu donburry is not bad although the meat is kinda tough.

Big portions, everyone's stuffed!
author: Novalina N.

description: Friendly staff, very nice and tasty Sushi. I can definitely recommend this place. Come early or be prepared to put your name on the waiting list. It's really worth visiting.
author: Sebastian A.

description: Cool spot in the heart of the Japan town mall. Quality not bad, good selection on the menu, and a nice cheap Sapporo or Kirin Ichiban beer to go with your meal. Service was great and the gentleman was very nice. Definitely a cool experience. I had the pork katsu + a california roll + something else that I can't remember. Cheap prices make me want to go back.
author: Ian S.

description: Pretty good for the price. Service is a tad slow. I recommend the tonkatsu and spider roll. Officially my new sushi spot.
author: Fernilla S.

description: Food tasted like watered down home cooking if your mom didn't really know how to cook. The price is the only good part. It's hard to find a place in Japan town let alone SF this cheap. Also service earned them a star since the waiters at the other restaurants nearby are all really stuck up but these guys are great.
author: Concerned C.

description: my me time !! thank you for the special treat !! guyz try the shrimp tempura !! Really tasty !! arigato !!
author: Don P.

description: The food was amazing (squid tempura was best squid tempura I ever had), and the prices are extremely reasonable for amount of food you get. Plus, it's always nice to go to not a chain restaurant.
author: Slava B.

description: Good food and portion sizes. I got the spicy yakisoba and it was very filling, piping hot, and super tasty. The only negative thing about my experience here was that there was a server that kept standing around doing nothing, and I had to ask for more water and flag him down when I was ready to order. Normally this would not be a big deal to me if it were super busy and if the restaurant was understaffed, but we came in around 5pm when the restaurant was pretty empty. With that being said, I would come back for the quality of the food and short wait time once my order was taken.
author: Grace Anne C.

description: They have a very diverse menu, lots of options. The gentleman who took our order was very accommodating. The location is fairly small, but still has plenty of seating options for different group sizes. The tempura veggie roll was seriously stacked with deliciousness. The spicy tuna roll was a great deal. The tempura squid legs were tender and full of flavor. Will definitely be back.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Cheap and affordable Japanese Cuisine! The lunch special is incredibly easy on the wallet. It's solid food as well. Not blow your mind amazing but hearty and cleanly executed.
author: Rafaello S.

description: Best price around Japantown. Lunch Bento Box price for 24/7. Very nice service with massive choices building your combo. Nice!
author: Yuzhou C.

description:
I love this place so much! My girlfriend and I have pretty much made it a habit of going here once every 1-2 weeks. 

The food is consistently good and they have a deal where for $9 you can choose two things  from a list of awesome items (I usually get the ramen with pork cutlet). The place is never too crowded and we never feel rushed while we are eating. 

5 stars all around.
author: Austin L.

description:
With dinner specials of $8.50, I was happy to eat here.

Stopped by before taiko practice, and nobody was here - maybe because everyone prefers Kintetsu Mall over East Mall, but I didn't mind eating alone. I ordered the ramen and saba shio combo, since it was a chilly SF night. The ramen was okay - pretty plain and a little below my standards of ramen, having been to many ramen places in the Bay Area and Japan...but the saba was amazing. I love how it comes with the daikon oroshii and lemon. It was just the right crispiness, and tasted delish. The server was nice as well. He asked if I wanted rice with the saba, and I thought it would cost extra, but I said yes anyway, and then when I looked at the bill, it didn't cost a thing. I was happy with that and quite full afterwards.

Seeing as I would have paid 8.50 for just the saba and rice, to get ramen along with that definitely brought happiness to my stomach and wallet, especially since the restaurants in Kintetsu are rather expensive :P
author: Brandon Y.

description:
Loved it!! Came around 7pm on a Saturday night and waited about 15 min...not too bad considering how small the place was. Everything was so cheap we kept ordering more and more and boy was it worth it! All of the specialty rolls were amazing and large portions for a Japanese restaurant. I would suggest not going for the "regular rolls" (California, Spicy Crunchy Tuna, etc) and go for their specialty rolls, all really yummy and not terribly expensive! Potstickers (6 pieces) were great to start, and I've never had spicy edamame before, but it was all great! 

I have never left a sushi place feeling stuffed, but I gladly did here! Happy happy belly and happy wallet!
author: Christy M.

description:
I can't believe that I had tasty donkatsu AND tacoyaki just for $8.99.
Miso soup was probably the best I had. 
For what I paid, I was very happy with what I got.
The food isn't like "OMG THIS IS SO GOOD" but it's tastes good enough to make anyone happy on a tight budget.
I had them to go and the portion was perfect. 

I am not sure how other food on the menu is rated but I'd love to try given my first experience was very satisfying.
author: S. K.

description: I love this place! Owners are very nice and always remember us when we come back. The Mad spicy ramen is my favorite, can't go wrong.
author: Luke G.

description: Came here for dinner with my mentor last night and enjoyed their dinner special for $9.99. I got the teriyaki chicken and California Roll with rice, salad and miso soup. It was such a sweet deal! The place is perfect for a party Of 2-4 people because it's a relatively small restaurant. Would definitely come here again!
author: Clarissa L.

description: The bento special for $9.49 is a good deal. It comes with 2 items with rice, miso soup and small salad. It is good potion and good price. I oreder Tonkatsu with shrimp tempura. They all yummy! A big piece of tonkatsu fried prok and 2 big tempura shrimp made me feel super full but I think the miso need more flavor. Overall is a good and I love their bento special but only 1 thing is if you come with very hungry you will get angry (lol) because the food is quite slowwww. Anyway must try it for your lunch, right?! :D
author: Orange S.

description: Food taste very home made and are served in huge portions. It's a great deal for the price. However, again it's a homey feeling and the food isn't impressively good or fresh. 4 stars for 1 $.
author: Ange L.

description: I have eaten here 3 times and absolutely love love love this restaurant. There is something so comforting about this cozy and unpretentious little shop conveniently located inside the busy Japantown plaza. The service is always efficient and the food is always delicious and affordable. Their menu offers a wonderful variety of food items (i.e. ramen, sushi rolls, sushi BURRITO, udon, etc, etc)  and can be quite daunting to someone who is indecisive (so bring your friends along and share as many dishes as you can!) My personal favorites are the curry udon and okonomiyaki (takes a while to make but the result is always piping hot). As someone who recently ate her way through Japan, I can say with confidence that Kui Shin Bo offers authentic Japanese comfort food. If you find yourself uncomfortably full after eating here, be sure to stop by Daiso/Japanese dollar store next door to help digest all that food!
author: Lingsheng L.

description:
So disappointing. Not sure why this place has so many stars from other reviewers.  

The service is seriously bad. 

We had to stack our own empty dirty plates and they were never cleared- even when the check was dropped.

They never checked on us and we had to wave and practically shout "excuse me!" Throughout our meal, just to get our initial cup of water or another pair of chopsticks.

Took a good 30/40 minutes after ordering just to receive edamame.

Food was average and mediocre.  One roll was rolled too loosely and fell apart when picked up.  Fried oysters had a weird texture like they were canned or something- not fresh.

Only 3 choices for ramen.  We ordered the traditional one and it smelled really gross.  Noodles had a good texture but were really oily.
author: Amber F.

description: Price is competitive and it tastes really good. I order sushi and miso Raman. There's not only Raman inside, but also egg,meat,vegetables. I really enjoyed this meal at noon.
author: Ruby C.

description: I was incredibly impressed with the sushi here. It was SO good! It's a cute little place in the back of a mall in Japantown. We discovered it on Yelp and decided to give it a go. Turns out, lots of other people ALSO love this place. We waited 30 min because it's a smaller place, but it was WELL worth it. The staff was very friendly and they told us that they're opening another restaurant closer to where we live. Talk about fate! We cannot wait to try the new place but will definitely visit this location too. Can't go wrong here, sushi lovers. Give it a go!
author: Kelly B.

description: Pretty good sushi! Very reasonable price as well! Very hospitable, and the udon was good too!
author: Anthony G.

description: Amazing gyozas, greaaaat ramen, cheap food, good service. Will definitely be back :)
author: Margaux M.

description:
This place is great!  Affordable Japanese food in Japantown.  I always go for the special (2 items for $8.50) which is the perfect amount of food to feed my bottomless pit of a stomach.

This small modest restaurant seems to be family owned and operated.  Always down to support small businesses :]
author: Anthony C.

description:
Overall Kui Shin Bo is deserving of 3 stars but the quality of service deserves a 5 stars rating. This is a mom and pops place and the owners are genuinely nice people. While waiting in line (at 8 on a Saturday), a girl waiting in line with us told us how she got a meal for free back when she couldn't afford to pay. Also, even though we were the only ones left in the restaurant near the end of our meal, the host waited very patiently for us to ask for the bill. No rushing, just very polite good service.

The food was okay though. I ordered tuna nigiri and a california roll. I felt there was a lot of rice and not that much of fish but to be fair, the food is fairly cheap. Sake was also cheap; two "large" (300 ml as a rough estimate) for 5$. They do give large portions though which is def a bonus but I would prefer less/better food.

Worth going for cheap sake, reasonably priced sushi in Japantown and great service. Left with good vibes and will be coming back.
author: C M.

description:
Great food, great service, and excellent value.

Owners are very nice.  Combination dinner deal and specials are great!
author: Joris P.

description:
Kui Shin Bo offers decent food at relatively cheap prices, but don't expect much more than that. Nothing really dazzles here. People probably give it extra points because it has a homey, hole-in-the-wall quality. The service is certainly friendly.

We came for lunch on a Saturday and waited 40 minutes for a seat. Our tempura shrimp was middling. The batter wasn't too greasy, but was crunchy like American fried food rather than lightly crisp like authentic tempura. Our teriyaki chicken and beef were also not bad, though the sauce was just a bit too sweet and too thick. 

Because Yelp readers have given it four stars, we'd expected Kui Shin Bo to be noticeably better than your average Japantown restaurant, which usually rate 3 or 3.5 stars. But we didn't find this to be the case. We wouldn't mind coming back because of the value for money, but not if the wait is longer than 10 minutes.
author: George C.

description: We had no wait, the waitstaff was courteous and prompt (even explaining some dishes to my friend). Our gyoza was fresh, ramen was good and broth spiced to our request, egg was a little over cooked, as was some of the pork. Excellent sushi rolls. And as everyone has mentioned: so affordable.
author: Shaz P.

description: I didn't get to try the food but based on the customer service I left. It was just me and I asked to sit at the sushi bar and the manger insisted I wait for 3 people ahead of me that wanted a table to be seated. I explained to him that I did not want a table and the sushi bar is empty and he insisted I wait 30 min so I insisted to take my money elsewhere and will not be returning.
author: Snow B.

description: Service was pretty lacking, but the food was really good. It's cheap and filling, not much more you could ask for when it comes to a sushi spot.
author: Joey P.

description:
Need some satisfying J-food, this restaurant is it. Wide variety of seafood, good rolls, & everyday deals. No complaints about service, do U really come for the food? Owners will try to open another(KSB,2) branch restaurant in about two weeks, Van Ness & Lombard streets;
will be wishing them more success...
author: Rod O.

description: This place was surprisingly great. Boyfriend and I headed to Japantown Center before hitting up the Kabuki for a flick and were the only ones in the place as we got there pretty darn early (we are talking early bird special.) We ordered some cheap, yet delicious beers, and some sashimi and rolls and were pleasantly surprised by the quantity and quality. The menu is huge, and I can't wait to go back to try some of their other tasty snacks.
author: Jane F.

description: Service was great but the maki's were really dry and not enough sauce. I don't particularly like it. :/
author: Sian C.

description: Glad I found a cheap place to eat in this neck of the woods, but would probably order something else next time. I got a combo of veggie tempura and ribs - the ribs were not good at all (also very bone-y), and I didn't like the selection of veggies? Open to trying it again, though.
author: Shendi X.

description:
The place is empty, friendly and quiet. Remember that ten dollar bill you were saving for a tug job in the Tenderloin from a tranny? Hang on to it and walk over to Japantown cuz you're better off getting dinner at Kui Shin Bo. 

$8.99 Special gets you two items plus miso and salad. If you order 2 sushi rolls you only get miso soup. I hate when people say this but sake it to me, baby! 

Be patient. Food takes awhile. Beer and sake will fill your wait with joyous tears. Let the tears drop from your face into your sake cup and drink it down quick. Chase it with your beer. Erase the sadness that is your life. Do it. 

Sake it to me, baby!
author: Sethy Wethy ..

description: We came here on the recommendation of a coworker and I'm so glad we did. It is really small and closes a lot earlier than most places in the city -8:30- so make sure you go early and it does fill up quickly so you'll probably have to wait. It was so worth it though! The noodle dishes are outstanding and the sushi is as delicious as it is beautiful. Friendly service too! They told us they were opening a 2nd location on Lombard Street, which is closer to my apartment so I see myself becoming a regular here!!
author: Brooke P.

description:
This is one reason made me favored San Francisco than I thought, that there are places that serves Japanese Tei-Shoku in "normal price" in Japan if not cheaper compared to some of Tei-Shoku restaurant in Japan.

The waitress and chefs were not Japanese when I visited for late lunch and they were talking in different language bug English or Japanese. But it is not really problem as the food themselves taste like Japanese and I could tell that they use Japanese ingredients and spices where they can.

The interior decoration is very like local Japanese Tei-Shoku style restaurant with the low ceiling and wooden chair and table. Wall decoration of all Japanese paintings and print makings. Only one of them were slightly like of Chinese but not quite sure, they mix in Japan as well so not really a deal.

the menu is written in Emglish and (Roma-Ji), with helpful pictures which is also very Japanese that makes easy to order from and comes quite close to the image on the menu.
Their rice is softer side, and food taste like really from ghee one of Japanese local Tei-Shoku Restaurants. 
Instead of ordering from lunch menu,
I had their Fried Oyster with Rice and miso soup, and salad. Also ordered 2 pieces of Sushi (Unagi) although. I could imagine the set would come with enough amount for a female, but I just wanted to try their sushi.

 Usually Tei-Shoku style restaurants do not serve sushi but why not it is California but Japan. The rice is soft ( using same rice from other menu) and slightly Marinated with Japanese vinegar, but not very distinct. The Unagi itself was good. ($3.5 for 2pc)
The waitress might not be very careful conscious with all tables but is very gentle and nice if customers ask any help, like is you need towel or paper to wipe hands, or if you would like water or tea or check.

The restaurant overall has relaxed atmosphere and I really enjoyed the meal there. I wish there were more like these low key local Japanese Tei-Shoku Ya in east coast as well.
author: Blue G.

description:
What a hidden gem!! My boyfriend and I had been wanting to get donburi and katsu for a while now, but couldn't find anything with "good" reviews on yelp. One day we just decided regardless of the star count, we'd try this place out due to the recently good reviews. 

We came to this cute little restaurant and was immediately seated. Our server was so friendly and helpful. We ordered the special ($8.99 for 2 dishes that come with rice, miso soup, and salad - what a deal!) of takoyaki and katsu, as well as the katsudon. I wanted some chicken karaage and though it wasn't on the menu, we asked our server and to our surprise they did have it!

Everything came out hot hot hot and quick. All our food was really good, but the katsu was my fav - it was nice and crispy with just the right amount of fat. Very well portioned too. 

I would def come here again!!
author: Tiffany T.

description: Excellent ramen. Excellent tonkatsu. Tasty Shrimp tempura. This place had a nice cozy feel and exceeded my expectations. It can get a bit crowded, so don't bring more than 4 people, or you'll be combining a lot of tables. To be specific I had the 4 alarm (the spiciest option; not too spicy for spice connoisseurs) Tonkotsu ramen, and it had an excellent flavor without being overly filling. Great prices too, compared to a lot of other SF restaurants I've been to. $9.45 for a quality bowl of ramen seems fair to me. Such a diverse offering all done very well makes this a good place to get general japanese food. If I'm in Japantown, I'm sure this will be my go to place to eat.
