author: Nick C.

description: Best deal in Japan Town! Get the special - two items from their list, a bowl of rice, miso soup, and salad for $8.99. My wife and I were both full, and the food was really good. The server was very nice as well. We'll be back for sure!
author: Christopher L.

description: Stumbled into Japantown thinking, wow, all of these places look like tourist traps.....but then, we jumped on Yelp and saw that this place has a ton of reviews and 4 stars. We figured, well, why not. Ok....no joke, this place in INCREDIBLE. Especially for the prices too! We had the pork okonomiyaki, black garlic ramen, miso soup, chicken kara age, and a sushi roll. All of them, so delicious. Ok we are definitely coming back here!
author: John B.

description:
We were in the neighborhood and hungry and so decided on Kui Shin Bo after a Yelp search (located on the 2nd Floor of Japan Center East).

We had high expectations and were sorely disappointed. It's possible we just ordered the wrong things...

We started with a Dynamite Roll, which was good. I then had the salmon teriyaki. The salmon was overcooked, lacked flavor, and had a fishy taste to it. The side salad served with the dish (lettuce with shredded carrots and dressing) was unremarkable and I didn't eat any after the first bite. The dish also came with white rice and miso soup. The miso soup was tasty and may have been the highlight of my whole meal. 

My dining partner had the Spicy Beef Yaki Udon. The beef cuts were fatty and almost inedible. The noodles were oddly flavored. Dining partner kept eating out of determination and to not make me feel bad about my Yelp dining choice.

The prices are VERY reasonable. Our whole bill was around $30. However, it wasn't worth it. I'd rather pay a little more and have food that I enjoy or pay less and eat in. Again, it may be that these particular dishes were disappointing and other fare might be better prepared. Unfortunately, we won't be returning to find out.

PS - As I was finishing my review, my dining partner had to go throw up (this was about 90 minutes after the meal). My two stars turned into one and all benefit of the doubt disappeared. There was something not right about the meat in the Spicy Beef Udon dish.
author: los f.

description: Family-owned restaurant tucked away in Japantown. I thought I'd discovered a secret gem but everyone seems to have caught on. Very affordable and delicious. The nigri is on point but they have everything from ramen and udon to a mix-and-match various dish special. My favorite place in Japantown.
author: David S.

description: Great sushi!! Also very quick service, great little spot to stop in with friends or even just solo at the sushi bar with a book.
author: Megan R.

description:
Still amazing. Still delicious. Still the best takoyaki. 

Service is always good and friendly. A great place to come for a casual lunch or dinner.
author: Amanda C.

description: As a local San Francisco foodie, I should have paid more attention to the yelp warning of poor food handling service. The people were nice and all. kudos to them, but the food did not reach my expectations for San Franciscian sushi. Talk about a waste of $50
author: Jackelyn A.

description: I ate here because of the 4 star rating on Yelp, but it was so disappointing. I ordered the spicy tuna roll which wasn't good--very bland and not much tuna. The shrimp tempura was inexpensive and a large portion, but everything was surprisingly tasteless-the tempura, dipping sauce and miso soup.
author: Debbie N.

description: This is my go to sushi place in San Francisco! It's very reasonably priced, and always delicious. My friends and I have tried countless roles off their menu and have yet to be disappointed. If you are looking for a great hole in the wall sushi restaurant, you have found it here!
author: Halle O.

description:
I ordered curry rice and wakame udon. Also sushi.

They both tasted really instant to me. And the sushi tasted subpar. 

The curry rice tasted all sludgy. And the udon broth was just boiled water. And some pieces of seaweed. 

Never coming here again.
author: Hina W.

description: Great prices and taste! Every other restaurant in Japan town turned me away with their high prices for okay food. Then I came across this little place during the lunch special and you can get two items with rice, miso, and salad if you don't get noodles for just $9.49. The waiter was also very nice, attentive, and informative about the menu. He introduced the daily special and saw that I wasn't eating my daikon so he advised to eat my saba dipped in soy sauce with daikon. It was pretty good!
author: Rachel L.

description: When I first walked passed this restaurant, I noticed the attractive prices!  "What a deal!" I thought.  After putting our name down on the waiting list, it took about 50 minutes till they called for us.  With prices this good and this much people waiting, this has got to be good......boy, was I wrong!  When my nigiri sushi arrived, I looked at it with my eyes popped out and jaws dropped.  What the heck is this?  The sushi rice looks like it was molded by a toddler.  No joke intended.  Underneath each piece of low quality fish was a piece of rice that was oddly shaped, gigantic sized, and packed extremely dense.  The chef behind the counter must have failed Sushi 101, but still decided to make sushi for a living.  Most of the conveyor belt sushi joints that I've been to has better sushi than this place.  Then I asked myself, "what the heck were you thinking, expecting good sushi for this kind of pricing."  It doesn't just end here.  The other items that we ordered were very disappointing as well.  This includes their yosenabe that was too bland, the takoyaki that needed more condiments, and their tempura which was overly battered.  The service was subpar also.  The staff wasn't too attentive and took a long time to get things for us when asked.  Other times, they just plain forgot.  If you are looking for cheap japanese food and don't care about the quality AT ALL, this might be the place for you.....
author: Steven L.

description: Our favorite sushi restaurant in Japan town. It's small but it's worth the wait. Everything that I've gotten has been really good and the staff are really nice.
author: Thanh V.

description: Very good place! All the katsu were delicious! And the Special Dragon roll & banana katsu was delicious also!! Would come back!!
author: Adrian M.

description:
Bad service, really bad food (much worse than standard)

This place is overrated.  The waitress looks like she wants to go home and only put the tray half way on the table (everything will be on floor if I don't catch it). We ordered super king roll, daily bento (fried oyster and pork katsu) and shrimp tempura udon.  The super King roll is bland.  Pork katsu and oyster are all dry.   Shrimp tempura udon is very salty.

Price of food is average.

Please, do yourself a favor and avoid this at all cost
author: Betty L.

description: I ordered sushi today and it was very tasty. I enjoyed the Rock n roll roll. Service was polite and it was an enjoyable place to eat.
author: Jeanne S.

description:
Came in here on a Saturday afternoon because I was shopping at Daiso and Ichiban Kan, and it was around lunchtime. The lunch special (two items plus rice, soup, and salad for $8.99) caught my eye, so I decided to give it a try. 

I wasn't disappointed. The food is pretty good, and the portions are big. I ordered the tonkatsu and the California roll as my two "side" items; I was expecting four pieces of the California roll, but was pleasantly surprised to find that there were eight pieces! I liked that they gave me the tonkatsu sauce in a bottle so I could just add however much I wanted. I do wish the miso soup had the seaweed (I don't know what the vegetable is called) in it, but it was perfectly fine without.

Service was good. The waiter (owner?) was really friendly and always had a smile on his face.
author: Sarah B.

description: Took my mom here for Mother's Day because her favorite Japanese restaurant is closed on Sundays and my mom LOVED it here! My mom had the two choice special of Teriyaki Chicken and the Agedashi Tofu. I had the two choice special of Saba Shio and the Agedashi Tofu. And we also ordered the Baked Salmon Roll. The food was very good. Service is slow but great price, fresh fish and  many choices. We'll be back to try their other dishes and sushi.
author: Jo C.

description: Came in on a Tuesday for lunch, our initial order was never placed. Food is mediocre and service is bad.
author: Steven S.

description:
This was a total failure in trusting Yelp rating for this restaurant. We were In busy Japan town on Friday evening and were desperate for sushi . The place had good rating so we went for it. My worries started as soon as we sat and start looking at their menu. The listed pricing was pretty cheap with very limited raw fish choices. And of course when the food arrived I realized we got what we've paid for. Pretty awful thin slices of sashimi that you can taste and feel it was recently pulled from a freezer.  My kids beef teriyaki tasted like the meet was cooked in microwave. Nothing really was any good down to their tea which tasted like it was brewed in unwashed coffee pot. The service was not much better either - amongst other poor services like; no refill of tea and water, never pick up used empty dishes, no extra cheap paper napkins and never once checking to see if the customer is doing ok, they had forgotten some of our dishes. We gladly canceled them. Moreover, the sushi chefs were eating behind the bar while slicing and rowing sushi and the place has low score from public health department. I'm really taken back by the rating this place has with poor quality food and services. 
We ended up eating crepes on the other side of Japan center which is delightfully edible. 
If you are bargain hunting for sushi and don't mine poor quality sushi and services then this is your place but please don't give 4 stars just because it was cheap
author: Billy W.

description:
The East Mall is the quietest place in the Japan Center, even with Daiso as a tenant downstairs. 

Likewise, Kui Shin No occupies a very unassuming position on the second floor of the building, a short walk away from hotel parking. 

Upon entering, the place itself isn't very large. Instead, you'd be more likely to appreciate its unpretentious interior and charming small-shop atmosphere. The man/waiter who greeted me a few steps into the door -  his friendly demeanor helps too. He's also really patient in explaining the menu for those not entirely acquainted with it.

The special -  two main items + rice, miso soup, and salad (the udon noodle soup is an exception; it already accounts for miso and rice in itself) for just under nine dollars -  it will fill you up.

I have no complaints about the food. It's the overall impression the place left on me that allowed me to leave feeling much more content with myself. 

(At peace, you might say.)
author: Kevin C.

description: Stopped for quick dinner of very ample Volcano roll, Beef teriyaki.and potato croquet - all fresh with very ample portions. Dinner total for two under $40. Sweet spot in corner of Japantown with a great family vibe.
author: Helen M.

description: I love this place. I will be back for more! I was looking for place that had more than just sushi. I got there combo meal. It was great price. It was 9.50 I believe for two items and it came with miso and salad. I got chicken  katsu and croqutte. It was so good. The next time I'm in Japan town. I'll be back for some more yummy food.
author: Mika M.

description: Holy cow(fish).  Amazing meal, solid prices and cool atmosphere.  Solid before seeing a movie at Kombuki up the street.
author: Byron P.

description:
I love this place and when ever I go to Japantown this is my lunch destination. The food is amazing, the staff is wonderful and super friendly. 

I am very picky with Asian food and this places passes my pallet with a A++

They have be to meals that are for $9 where you choose 2 items from the meal.
Beware if you do order the ramen it does not come with miso.
author: Demetria Y.

description: The food here is awesome,  especially the Okonomiyaki. I could have had 5 of them!  There were some challenges with communication as they didn't get all of our order but it worked out well as we had plenty of delicious food! It'll be a new fave for sure!
author: Kat R.

description: Very reasonable 2 item dinner bento at $8.99. Go for the teriyaki beef with its char broiled taste.  I'll be back to try the other items!
author: Doug W.

description:
Kaki nabe is an oyster soup in a clear broth with soft tofu cubes, Napa cabbage, green onion, and bean threads. It's a dish that shines with good quality ingredients, because there's nothing to mask the flavor of oysters, and shine it did. I didn't even order it, but I had enough of my companion's nabe to have to apologize afterward!

I shared just as much of my dish, however, to make up for my tabletop poaching. My curry rice went wonderfully with the kushi katsu, a breaded and deep fried sea bass that was like the best fish stick I've ever had. 

The food was excellent, the service was great, and we both left stuffed and happy.
author: Corinna S.

description:
We went there on Sunday before noon. We ordered the menu and the sushis rolls. Everything was very good. The owner was very helpful and he recommended me the fish katsu which tasted good. The  shrimp tempura was lightly battered and not greasy.
There was a waiting list after noon so this place fills up quickly since it is small.
I would go back there.
author: Lionel T.

description: On a quick trip and decided I wanted some japanese food. The wait can be a little long if you are in a hurry but the food was fantastic. The lunch special is a great deal and a lot of food. I got the curry and ramen.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Lunch with two items for $8.50. Such a deal. After some shopping at Ichiban Kan and Daiso in Japantown I decided it was time to eat some lunch. Kui Shin Bo is situated close to Ichiban Kan, it is small and bare bones minimum in term of decorations.

I ordered the California rolls with the deep fried oysters. I thought they did a nice job with the oysters not greasy and crunchy. The roll were average quality. Rice, salad and miso accompanied the lunch. But the restaurant must be better then average because it was almost full. 

Good service - they provided water when the glasses were empty.

Overall 3.5 stars
author: Jim D.

description: The food is amazing, especially for the price. They had a really good bento special.  Their sushi was fresh and filling.  The gyouza was perfectly fried and scrumptious.  The whole thing went down nicely with a chilled Asahi.  A perfect stop when touring Japantown.
author: Gabriel M.

description: This place is the only place I can call a flawless restaurant. It serves the best japanese food at the best prices nearby. The service is on another level as the employees really try to help you enjoy your meal. Good recommendations on menu items. I got the saba with tofu and it was a perfect pairing. The food is very healthy and filling. This is my favorite japanese place. The staff is very attentive and I got my check within 1-2 minutes after finishing my meal. That's what I call efficiency.
author: Jasper W.

description:
What's better on a hot Saturday night in J-Town than free ice-cold sake? Why having sushi rolled for you by the former owner/chef of Kui Shin Bo AND scoring free booze too!

We lucked out this past Saturday evening when we peeked into Kui Shin Bo's doorway only to see the prior chef behind the sushi counter. Ever since he sold the place, it's been off and on with the sushi here and we were very happy to see him working again! The new owners were also offering free cold sake that night too! WOOT!

So this guy really knows his fish! The selection is much smaller now but the quality that he chooses is still of the highest caliber. The maguro that night (see pic) was stellar! It was brilliantly garnet in color, sweetly tender, and buttery smooth! We really were not disappointed with any of his selections that night, from the hirame, saba, toro, ika, to the totemo oishii salmon! ALL were deliciously and expertly prepared! I asked him in Japanese what his favorite roll to make was and he smiled and presented us with the "Volcano" roll (see pic). OMG, I could eat this every night! What's more, his sushi rice continues to be perfectly al dente in texture, not too warm or cold, and delicately fragranced!

As for the rest of the menu, oops, sorry, we came here for the sushi, were happy that we did, but will check it out in the future! Until then, I truly HOPE the new owners keep the former one on staff for a long time!!!
author: Richard T.

description: $8.99 for a choice of two items plus miso soup and tossed salad.  The chicken Katsu and tonkatsu is light and crispy.  The Crunchy roll with shrimp tempura and crab is delish!  Teriyaki chicken has quite a bit of sauce, sweet not savory. The two choice daily special is a deal!
author: Lorene P.

description:
My husband and I have been coming here for years and always have a wonderful experience.  The lunch combo special is a value and we crave the egg noodle with garlic and chicken.  

I like that this restaurant is out of the way and in the slower moving mall.  It's a family owned restaurant of which the owner recognizes us when we come in, which is not that often as we are coming from the East Bay.

We have tried many of the restaurants in Japan Town and most of them are so-so.  This place keeps us coming back for the value and flavor.  Now if you go by Nobu K.'s review, I would say you too are a bit of a raciest.  I come to a restaurant to enjoy the food, not the nationality of the owners.  There are truly authentic Japanese restaurants in the neighborhood, but if you are cruising around J-Town and want a quick lunch at a good value, this is your place.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Came here because I was attracted to the 8.50 Bento Box Lunch Special and I was NOT disappointed. THERE WAS MORE THAN ENOUGH FOOD TO BE ON IT! The Waiter/Owner was sweet and very kind. 
Food was made in a timely manner and it was delish.

Only thing is it gets quiet as you eat; it would be nice to have some music to listen to as you chow down. 

Definitely coming back when I make it back to Japantown!
author: Erika D.

description: Great Japanese restaurant on the second floor of Japan Center in Japan Town.  $10 lunch specials with 2 options.  Each option is a full meal by itself.  Cheap but very good food!  Loved the garlic noodles!
author: Jocelyn K.

description: The only restaurant worth going to in Japantown. Their ramen is delicious and cheap. Sometimes there is a bit of a wait at peak hours, but compared to all of the awful dirty places next door it is worth the wait and the staff is so friendly!
author: Anastasia J.

description: Omg I love this place. They make the best katsu with curry. I come by every week just because their cooking is the bomb!!
author: Romeo C.

description:
I honestly don't understand how this place was able to get so many positive reviews.  I actually ate here based on the Yelp reivews.  What a big mistake.  My dinner friend had the teriyaki chicken with tonkatsu.  The chicken teriyaki tasted gross and the tonkatsu had a funny oil taste.  My beef teriyaki was gross.  The sauce tasted funny and the beef quality is lacking.  My ramen tasted strange as well.  The noodle tasted sour and the cabbage tasted bitter and sour.  The broth was fairly salty.  On top of that, the service was lousy.

Never again.  What a waste of money and time.
author: Food S.

description: Literally the best sushi I have ever had. The volcano and the rock and roll were amazing. Started with takoyaki and I went to bed a very happy man.
author: Equan S.

description: Tried it out based on reviews (very misleading). Mediocre at its best. If you're starving with no place to go, it will satisfy. If you're looking for good to great sushi, go somewhere else.
author: Crena D.

description:
Why do I love this place?? 

- The workers are attentive and amazing sweet hearts!! *They remind me of my grandpa and grandma. 

- Two item lunch combo for less than $10. *Quick, efficient, tasty and affordable.

- Their "my size" tables and chairs!! *Seriously, for the folks who have been here, aren't their tables and seats great for us little folks??

I can't tell you how much I adore this spot, workers and food. Their decor needs an update but they make up for it with their generous, helpful and attentive personalities and great food.
author: Anonymous P.

description:
Recently found this place and our family really likes it.

Their specials are super cheap and really yummy. I always end up getting the tofu, chicken or beef skewers or udon. Fair warning though, the curry is like pumpkin or something, so not my thing but otherwise everything is yummy.
I also love how tiny the chairs are. Perfect for someone short like me! 
Also the servers are really nice.
author: Samantha Y.

description: Delicious little hidden gem on the second floor of the east mall in Japantown. The ramen and rolls were made of quality and technique. All of the food was very tasteful and appealing. The restaurant is quiet and small with less than 10 tables inside. There may be a bit of a wait, but nothing worth stopping your from checking out.
author: Bobby J.

description: I came twice due to good reviews on Yelp.  I thought it was just mediocre.  I went for dinner the first time around when there was a wait, but then followed it up again during the work week where the place is only a third full.  It was just ok both times.
author: Alex T.

description: Very small restaurant inside Japan Mall. Service is fantastic and sushi is excellent. I will definitely be back.
author: Elena B.

description: I came on a Sunday waited about 30 minutes to get in. Food took about 40 minutes to be served and not once did they come to my table to ask for further service or a refill. The food was mediocre at best. Definetely not worth the wait. I ordered the ramen with Tonkatsu. The broth of the ramen wasn't too flavorful.  The Tonkatsu wasn't too bad but not something I would order again. I would have gave this one star but the price was reasonable.
author: Johnny H.

description: This place was fantastic!!!!  The food, service, and prices were all great!  I had the sesame chicken lunch special and it was perfect.  On top of that, I love the traditional Japanese looks of the place.  and the server was so kind and attentive, it really was impressive.  When in the mood for a nice traditional Japanese lunch or dinner, this is my favorite pick!
author: Nicholas B.

description:
Ladies in my family love shopping at Ichiban.  So after fishing them out of the store, we were all ready to eat.  In the mood for udon and ramen which you can get a number of restaurants in Japantown Mall.  Kui Shin Bo is right next to the store and was advertising a 2 item $8.50 dinner.  Since udon or ramen alone is usually about that, we decided to try it.

Place was pretty empty, in contrast to the restaurants in West Mall, which were pretty full (we walked over after dinner).  All 4 of us ordered some combination of udon/ramen.  2 of us had chicken teri, 1 tonkatsu, 1 oysters.   We devoured the udon and ramen.  Noodles were nice and light, broth not too salty and each included some veggie (if you count seaweed as a veggie).  Our dinners weren't supposed to come with rice, but when we asked they gave us some.

Portions were fine, we ate it all but left full.  Not the best quality Japanese food we've had, but a great value for a Saturday night dinner.
author: Steve G.

description: I don't understand spoiled reviewers who rate the wall paper. This place is amazing. Appreciate it! Will definitely come here again.
author: A. A.

description:
The place is alright:

Staff: friendly, their English is so so
Space: 30 ppl seems to be the max
Food: meh
Time: a little on the slow side in getting food
author: Nikki S.

description: I went with a friend for lunch. The restaurant has the special of 2 items for 9+ dollars, and it was worth it! I chose Saba shio and spicy salmon roll. The roll has 8 pieces, and this is a lot b/c I never saw a combo that gives this many pieces. Also, I really LOVE the service here. The person who brought me the food saw that I wasn't sure why there's radish and lemon together with the saba, and he came to show us how Japanese people eat saba shioyaki. Awesome. Good/fast service, very reasonable price, tasty food for the price. It was all very pleasant.
author: Lam T.

description: My standards were raised from other reviews but unfortunately were crushed.  The squid was rubbery and badly grilled with a hint of teriyaki.  I asked for more to mask the taste.  Next came our unagi and white tuna.  The sushi rice was sweet and moist, the unagi was pretty standard but the white tuna was sub par...not buttery and fatty like it should be.  We shared a dragon roll and sent it back because I requested no avocado.  Thank goodness I did because the avocado had already turned brown.  Lastly we indulged in the ramen.  This was the only saving grace.  The black garlic was aromatic and earthy and aided in a savory broth.  The pork was done nicely with bean sprouts and basil for a good flavor and texture balance.  We got spicy B and it was every bit of it.  Very dissapointing if expecting a higher taste quality.  I imagine if you want a cheap lunch of basics then it's better than nothing.
author: Nicholas L.

description: I really wonder why my review is blocked .. LOL but yes I still recommend this place.
author: Yumi K.

description:
My partner and I have been coming here frequently since we started seeing each other. I think we have been here at least once a month over the last two years. 

It is a family run business and we really appreciate the warm atmosphere and the affordability of the place. Great choices on the menu and always leave happy. 

My favorite is the seaweed udon, Kaki (fried oysters), and .... oh so many things. It inexpensive, satisfying and just good. And run by good people. What more can a person ask for.
author: Scott K.

description: solid ramen and sushi, with an attractive lunch deal. decor is a bit dated. two signs warning against drinking while pregnant and a Heimlich maneuver chart compete with some dusty or yellowed traditional Japanese paintings. funny stuff.
author: John S.

description:
I am sorry but I have to stand by my previous review.
Chinese own amateur lame Japanese food.

Don't fool around by the CHEAP lunch combo.
Choose items and rice and miso soup for $8.50.
My 2 items are Ramen and Curry over rice.
The Ramen was instant, top-ramen kind.
And the Curry was the same as Trader Joe's instant indian curry.
It is not a cooking.
It's microwaving.
From a instant ready-made curry package from TJ's!
I am very sure of it.

This is nothing new.
What's new is, there are people still fooling by the cheap combo menu.

This is very serious and very scary behavior.

I am still very worry and skeptical for those Chinese own Japanese restaurants.

Ken K. said, "OK this confirms that it still sucks. Kaka Shin Bo :-("
author: Nobu K.

description: Came here because it got good reviews plus 4 stars. It was very ordinary. I was dissapointed.
author: JC C.

description: From the start, the owner helped me out a lot - a few perfect, in-depth suggestions, and I didn't even ask. I appreciate that, since he knows his restaurant better than I do! The food was fantastic, and at a great price. I really don't think I could have asked for anything more (except miso! so good!).
author: Jacob S.

description: Favorite place to eat in Japan Town. Their bento box specials are the best and very affordable. Will definitely return.
author: Mr. T.

description: Loved the Volcano Roll. Ignore the "snow crap" misspelling in the window for this roll. It's amazing.
author: David I.

description:
I have tried some of  the other restaurants in Japantown, but from my own personal experience, Kui Shin Bo is the best for its price point and good food. For $8.50 you get your pick of a variety of menu items such as curry with rice, tempura, agedashi tofu, teriyaki, udon, ramen, katsu, and much more! The portions are very generous for a restaurant located in San Francisco and directly inside the Japantown mall. 

I typically order the curry with rice and veggie tempura. If you don't order any of the soups (udon, ramen, etc) you also get miso soup and salad. Their tempura is the best I ever had. The batter is just right and it isn't ridiculously greasy like other places. You can still see the vegetable but still have a bit of a crunch to bite into when you eat the tempura. The curry is delicious too. It definitely does not taste like pre-packaged curry you get at the store. The meal all together is very wholesome and adequately filling (you won't want to get full anyway - you gotta try some desserts in other parts of Japantown while you're there ;) ). Their agedashi tofu is really good, too. If you get a combination like ramen and curry rice as your two items, it's like having two separate meals in one sitting! It's great! 

There's a man who is always there when I visit. He is a nice man with a thick Japanese accent. He is very kind and attentive. 

The interior of the restaurant is very cute. It feels a little bit like a legit restaurant in Japan and has really cute little seats and tables. 

Overall, I really think this restaurant is great. It is not over the top and is a modest little restaurant that deserves more customers. I would hate to see this place go. I'm a little saddened by some reviews saying that they did not like their food or experience at Kui Shin Bo, but I guess everyone has their own personal preference. I think it is worth giving it a shot. It's located in the other mall with Daiso and Ichiban Kan - so if you're looking to mellow out and get away from the busier side of Japantown, come to Kui Shin Bo to give them a try and see for yourself.
author: Elle L.

description: I've been here twice and I'm so in love. The staff is attentive and recognizes you -- the food is delicious and the portions are good. No complaints
author: Cecilia A.

description:
This restaurant is next to the Ichiban Kan general dollar store in Japantown's Plaza Mall, and is trying to find an identity and patronage. 

We came here because we had a 7pm appointment in 45 minutes, so we wanted something quick and cheap. Kui Shin Bo fit the bill for those, as they have a "Any 2 items for $8.50" white board dinner special. There is a large choice for the two items, from Sanma Shioyaki to Unagi Donburi, to the more common and the usuals like teriyaki, tempura, California rolls, etc. 

It was 6:00pm on a Saturday night after Thanksgiving, and we were the only two people there for 45 minutes. Maybe everyone was shopping at Macy's downtown, or at Toys R Us or Best Buy, as the J-Town mall wasn't particularly busy on that end either. 

The staff is definitely not Japanese. I couldn't tell if it was Cantonese or something similar I heard form the kitchen. 

The food was OK, actually a good amount for the price, with rice, a small salad, miso soup and the 2 items you selected. I had Saba Shioyaki and Tempura, the Fave Relative had beef teriyaki and California roll. She liked hers (her palate is still developing), but mine was at best OK. The Tempura batter wasn't very light and crisp, and the Saba likewise didn't have that crispiness you seek in a good Mackerel grill. But for $8.50, how can you complain?

I didn't open the menu to see if they still have Burmese and Indian dishes as some of my Yelp friends have mentioned since ownership changed a year or two ago. There were none of those on the 2 items white board. The sushi bar freezer case was empty, so looks like they have given up on that part of their business, focusing on less perishable kitchen dishes. 

I don't know how they are going to stay alive with $8.50 dinners from 2 people/hour on a Saturday night. Maybe they do a better lunch business from the bargain hunters coming out of Ichiban Kan. 

Like I said, it fit the bill for quick and cheap.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
Wow, I hesitated to try this restaurant in J-Town next to Ichiban-kan because of their lit sign that reads "Fine Japanese Cuisine serving Teriyaki, Sukiyaki, Tempura, and Udon."  I think the sign serves as negative marketing, especially for someone like myself who hunts for good authentic Japanese restaurants.  I finally decided to try it after reading some positive reviews from Yelpers.    

The first good sign was the list of specials (see attached picture) hand-written by a Japanese person.  As I entered, I became worried because there was no other customers at 1pm on Sunday afternoon.  But after we were seated, many other customers started to pour in.  

Interior of the restaurant (see pic) was much nicer than the negative marketing sign outside.  Well, get's get to the important part - food!  They served really nice authentic Japanese comfort foods, like Katsudon (fried pork cuttlet rice bowl) which was done really nicely with eggs kept juicy and the right amount of soy sauce flavoring.  Their halibut kama lunch special was also excellent.  I felt that miso soup was sweeter than what I prefer, but each person has their own likings.

The elderly Japanese waitress was in a really bad mood.  She looked like she did not want to be there.  I'm sure she wasn't feeling great on a Sunday near ending of lunch hour, but her attitude was quite depressing.  Perhaps I caught her on a bad day, but still, I cannot give 5 stars for such service.

I went back this time for dinner.  Again, I found this place to offer solid meal at reasonable price ($28 for two after tip&tax), but for me, this is more of a lunch place.  I highly recommend that you stick to 4-5 specials on the board.  In fact, don't even open the menu, because chef is communicating to you through the board that you will be treated to freshest ingredients if you order their daily special.  The special of the day, curry-don and grilled pork-ginger combination was quite filling.  Curry was so-so, but pork dish was very nice.  Their fried oyster dinner was not bad, but nothing special.
author: トモ T.

description: Sometimes when I go out to eat sushi I get a particularly fresh or tasty cut of fish. Sometimes I get a good chef, and sometimes the roll is a well balanced mix of flavors. The planets must have lined up or something because the Volcano Roll changed my life! It was such a wondrous sight I almost didn't want to eat it. But I saw the ingredients and knew that it would be delicious. The first bite was incredible, and there was many more to have before i finished. Every bite was as god as the one before. Anyways, i don't post much on yelp, but the Volcano Roll and Kui Shin Bo deserve my praise. They also deserve your patronage, give them a try.
author: Sean S.

description: Went here as my true first Sushi experience. Wow this food was great & their specials were so inexpensive for the amount of food you get! The cheapest meal I bought the 4 days I was in SF!!
author: Josh F.

description:
Service was great. But if you're not here for a lunch deal, you may be overpaying for anything else.

We ordered some sushi and sashimi. The white tuna, in particular, was of questionable color, texture and flavor. I'd stick with more mainstream selections next time. We were rather hungry, so the donburi was very hearty and appreciated.
author: Sophie C.

description: Ordered online, and wait time said 10-35 minutes. An hour later, still the food wasn't ready. The staffer at the restaurant told us that they're having "computer issues" with Eat24. Okay... how about a notification or a phone call? When we finally got the food, it was messily put together, with tons of rice and very little fish on the rolls. Not worth the wait, not worth the price, not worth the customer service.
author: Convict T.

description: It's alright. Not a fan.  My Nabeyaki Udon lacked taste but hubby says Rock & Roll and Volcano rolls were not bad. Me? Not going back.
author: Jeni R.

description:
Pretty damn decent sushi, and hella cheap! 

A bit far from where I live, but might go back if I was in the area.
author: Chloé M.

description:
Really good! Good relation price quality!Fully recommended! Nice! 
The menu was enough to get full and the people is very nice!
author: Pau C.

description: This food was so yummy!! The salmon melts in your mouth. The house special  rolls were good. Definitely  return.
author: Marie B.

description: I don't know if the food is good or not because I never received it. I used YelpEat24 for the first time and order from this restaurant. I live only 5 blocks or less from the restaurant. After 1 hr and 20 mins, I tried to call restaurant but got voicemail. I tried to contact eat24 but they was busy. Finally I got thru to eat24. They tried to get a hold of the restaurant but couldn't either. So I cancel my ordered. My advice......unless u can wait for 2 hrs after ordering online. Stay away from this place.
author: Cuong P.

description: First time going to this place and it was delicious! The lunch special is a great choice and reasonable priced. My friend and I had some beef teriyaki, vegetable croquettes, tonkatsu with rice, salad and soup. Great service too. The servers answer our questions about the menu and about the sauce nicely.
author: Lily C.

description: Fantastic family owned place with excellent food and great deals. I would definitely return!
author: Bernadette D.

description: Great value and super friendly service makes this little backwater J-town eats place worth stopping in for a perfect takoyaki fix. Specials on the 8.99 combo are great for mix and match fixins lunch or dinner time. Go on a dark rainy night for that Blade Runner authentic feel.
author: Tristan C.

description: My boyfriend and I go here when we are free. We go here like 3-4 times a week. The Special Menu keeps us full, it's a reasonable price and to us it's very delicious. I love this place. Their Miso soup is not salty like others. The owner...I think he is the owner...he is also a waiter. He is really nice and attentive. If you're looking for a place to eat and be full with a good price. Come to this place. I promise you won't regret it.
author: Sonia N.

description:
Stopped by here for dinner tonight and it was ok. They have daily specials that are super cheap. $7.50 for your choice of two bento box items. wow. 

I didn't order that tho. I had the chirashi bowl, agetashi tofu, and the volcano roll. everything was so so except the volcano roll, that was delicious! chirashi bowl - the fish felt kinda old... agetashi tofu didn't feel like it was fried... but still tasty. i just love tofu in general. volcano roll was super yummy. it had tempura shrimp wrapped with avocado and topped with snow crab. that was delicious.

Probably won't come back since there are many more restaurants to try in Jtown.
author: Cynthia C.

description: This place is amazing, I love there service and there sushi is clean and on point. Definitely going to come back again
author: Nanita B.

description: Great service and food. The curry rice, California roll, and volcano roll were especially delicious. Definitely recommend the lunch special. So many different choices. I wish I could've chose them all, haha.
author: Kris T.

description: So glad I stumbled upon this adorable little gem tucked away in the corner of Japantown! It's definitely on the teeny side and service is pretty slow (~30 minute wait to be seated for a party of 5, and then ~30 minute wait for food) , but it really feels like you are eating a home cooked meal prepared with love. The bento boxes are a steal at $10 each, and naturally everyone ordered 2 bento boxes for themselves (someone got 2 bentos and a sushi burrito. our sweet waitress was shocked and asked in disbelief "are you sure you can finish all that?!?!?!" In her defence, I don't think powerlifters frequent Japantown often..) I was the only one who got a normal meal for myself - the sushi sashimi combo - and the chef threw in 4 extra CA rolls hehe! I tasted a bit of everyone else's food - the miso was not overly salty, the chicken katsu was ultra crispy, beef teriyaki was tender and juicy, chicken teriyaki was moist, beef Okonomiyaki was to die for.... I will definitely be back for more!! :)
author: Shawna C.

description: hamachi Kama and oyakodon, hole in the wall feels authentic
author: Christina K.

description: Disappointed, service was poor and the sushi below average. Had a spider roll that might be the worst one I've ever had and a Seattle roll that was ok. Gave up on ordering anything else after almost a hour to get the two rolls.
author: Chuck R.

description: omg I love this place.  the owners are super friendly and the sushi is gooood.  I always get the volcano roll but pink lady is also a solid choice.  jk they're all good.
author: Olivia N.

description: This place is amazing.  We just had the miso ramen, which was so good and the pieces of fish are so buttery they melt in your mouth. A must visit!
author: Hayley B.

description: Staff was very friendly! This place is great if you are craving Japanese food but are a little tight on cash. I would have to say that the quality is definitely better than what you would expect for the specials price. Two items, including rice, miso soup and salad cost just $8.99. Sushi was ok in it but everything else was pretty right on.
author: Ari M.

description: It took more than an hour after we ordered for them to start cooking our food and I got food poisoning an hour later. The food tasted good and the waitstaff did a good job, but the restaurant was clearly accepting an irresponsible amount of to go orders. About 45 minutes passed where the only food coming out of the kitchen was for to go orders, while half the restaurant was waiting for food. That's just poor management, and I bet the food poisoning happened due to cross contamination after the kitchen tried to cut some corners to get food out faster.
author: Andy H.

description: Excellent value and fresh sushi. The sushi is fresh. Bento box is a good value also with any 2 items for $9.49. Service is prompt and good. I will come back again next time I am here.
author: Victor L.

description: Happened to find this place while looking for something delicious in Japantown. Very friendly staff and their special deal is really good: two main items from a very long list plus a bow of rice, salad, and miso soup... All for about 8-9 dollars. I got the teriyaki chicken and the chicken katsu so it was a good portioned meal that left me quite full. The quality was also excellent and well exceeded the price. I will definitely be stopping by again the next time I'm traveling to San Fran.
author: Lewis L.

description: Average sushi, terrible service. Took over an hour to get any food after waiting 30+ minutes to be seated. Not really that cheap unless you get the combo set but thats not good for sharing if you're in a group.
author: Mike L.

description: The place was kinda hard to find. When we arrived we were ushered out immediately with no explanation until we realized the small sheet of paper stapled to the door way to sign our party even though the was no one else waiting and there were tables open. The atmosphere was small and cramped. That was the only negative. Our waiter was very friendly, but he wasnt very attentive. The food was very authentic, tasted exactly like what I got when I was in Japan.
author: Erica B.

description: very tasty～ I like the cheap combo～ so does my son. with a combo they add with a soup、 a salad. no minimum charge，more valuable.
author: Shuangyue X.

description:
$8.50 Bento Box Lunch Special is a steal in Japantown. This may not be the most haute couture Japanese food, but the staff and food possess authenticity. I've have about 7 different items on the bento menu and all are quite tasty. My hope is that continued traffic will continue to feed back into this restaurant. Garlic noodles, fried oysters, tonkatsu, and teriyaki beef are particularly tasty. Saba mackerel and other mackerel is great if you know how to eat a whole fish that has a healthy amount of little bones. 

I've been back 3 times, and I expect it will happen again!
author: N B.

description: Not bad and not good food. Prices ok. Staff very friendly. Thought japanese food is not fried but in this shop all food is fried.
author: Maike D.

description: We wanted sushi.  It was OK.  After we ordered we noticed everyone else in the restaurant had bento boxes or ramen.  Maybe we ordered the wrong thing?  This place is popular though.  Be prepared to wait.
author: Ben O.

description: I don't understand why this place was completely empty at 7pm when Takara across the way was completely packed with a waiting list. I got the 2-item bento special for $8.99, with battered cod, agedashi tofu, and it of course came with miso soup and rice. The portion of cod was very generous, and the agedashi very flavorful. A really solid dinner for this price! I wouldn't go outta my way to come here, but it's a decent spot if you're in this shopping complex. Left very happy and full.
author: Sophia C.

description: My closest friends and I have been here 2 days in a row because of how amazing their food is. Nestled in a mall, prices are much lower than you would expect, and the staff are friendly and very helpful. Pay no attention to any review under 4 stars, this place is the best food for the best prices you will find in japantown.
author: Matthew J.

description:
we ordered sake and we could've gotten it for free!
I knew we shoud've checked yelp before coming in!

of all the bustling sushi and japanese restaurants in this strip mall, this one looks worn and old in the corner compared to the rest.
inside was no different. it looked tired inside and out.
chairs had odd proportions...just because it's japantown doesn't mean the tall people don't come in too! (um..jk) =X

although empty, it was a bit hard to capture waiter attention. however the waiter we had was very nice. 

our table ordered some tuna and some other kind of fish. but it was clear that the fish was frozen and they simply thawed it, cut it up and put it on a plate with a bit of wasabi. not much presentation here.
kitsune udon soup was refreshing and enjoyable. However udon noodle is smaller size than average and it was a bit plain overall. 
avokyu rolls were good. but they weren't anything extraordinary. ingredients tasted fresh and rice was soft.
we also ordered a fish bento box. standard with rice, veggies, and fish.
edamame on the side. i love edamame but i was disappointed in the portion size. $4.50 for a cup? i know places who charge the same but give out a plateful!

overall satisfying, but nothing spectacular. their specials include burmese-styled dishes so if you're into Burmese food, this might be a good stop.
author: Lanie L.

description:
Hungry on a Saturday afternoon, we decided to drive to the Japantown Mall for lunch. There are so many little restaurants in the mall, I didn't bother Yelping it. We just picked a random one and walked in. Not the smartest thing to do normally, but it ended without any infections or medical care. Good to know right?

They had special items listed on whiteboards. You choose 2 items and it comes with salad, miso soup, and rice. It was about $8 for the combo. I went with the salted mackerel and curry rice.

Out comes this big bowl of rice loaded with Japanese curry. It was good. The mackerel was small and bony but seasoned well. The small salad had a tangy dressing that's addictive.

Service was prompt and friendly. The best part was seeing our bill, it was super cheap for what you get. It was a satisfying lunch.
author: Minh D.

description: Was here 2 h ago. It was surprise for me, finally I found what I need! The best Japanese food in SF!Unique,unusual and the most tastier! love it!!
author: Yana C.

description: Good food, lower prices and good service.  The mall is empty but this place would have a line anywhere else.
author: Steve T.

description: Small, friendly staff, I think it might be family owned. The restaurant isn't very busy and I don't know why- the sushi was great. We had some nigiri and the eel roll.
author: Ana I.

description: Our family loves it here! The service is great and the food is even better. We love the special offer that comes with 2 entrees, miso soup, salad and rice for $9.49. Highly recommend it!
author: Nora P.

description: I was visiting Japantown for the first time and stumbled upon this little place right next to Ichi Ban . I ate here with the family on a Friday afternoon and the ambience was quite welcoming.                                                                                                            They provide an awesome special for 8.95 - choice of 2 entrees with a side of rice and miso soup. Each family member ordered a different item so we were able to try a variety. Their beef teriyaki is incredible !!! Hands down favorite dish and I usually stick to the sushi. Ramen noodles, tempura, pork katsu, oysters, spicy tuna and curry rice rocked! I will definitely be visiting again! I provided pics! Oh man, and the presentation was great as well...
author: Andrea C.

description: Everybody knows that some of the best restaurants are simple hole in the wall places. Although Kui shinbo is far from a hole in the wall,  it is one of the best places to eat Japanese food. I highly recommend this place. It its worth the the trip, if you're  in the neighborhood. I rate it 10/10, easily. Try something you've never heard of. You'll be glad you did.
author: Sam V.

description: Fantastic. The black garlic ramen was fantastic! The gyoza was best I'd ever had and was light and tasty. Really good food and service.
author: Peter R.

description:
It was by accident that my friends and I have stumbled upon this eatery - we had the hardest time choosing a place to dine in. We went in as we were lured by the menu that was out in the open. We were seated fairly quickly since there weren't many customers yet. The waiter, which I'm guessing is the owner (?), gave us the menu and delivered a more descriptive selection by speech. He was kind and got things done at a swift pace so we left a hearty tip. 

The food was definitely something. I don't know if it's because I was starving but the food tasted extra special. In my friend's word, it tasted homemade; it's as if your parents-were-cooking-you-that-meal sort of thing I guess. I got the udon with tempura all for $8.50. The broth for the udon was tasty and didn't taste like the other Japanese restaurants. Two of my friends who ordered the udon agreed that the broth was something different - in a good way of course. The tempura was lightly battered and the sauce that accommodated the dish was "light" and not too thick as I had in other places. I ate up my delicious meal and left, promising to return whenever I'm in Japantown again. 

Oh, and they have takoyaki, which was a surprise! :)
author: Emily M.

description:
I feel horrible ... bashing this restaurant's face in the way I'm about to. But I gots to keep it real. This place had the oldest, stringiest maguro I've ever tasted. It was NOT fresh. Even with copious amounts of soy sauce, I couldn't get myself to finish off my 4 nigiri. It had this really fishy taste as well as a film that was on the verge of slimy. I'd imagine that these pieces were the last to be chosen at the fish market. The scraps ... the sub-par ... And, adding insult to injury, the sushi rice was waaaay too sweet. Sushi here was not done well. I will never, ever eat here again.

Man, just thinking about the fish is giving me traumatic flashback and dry heaves. I will say that if you DO wind up eating here, stick to their fully cooked items (ie bento boxes). That seems like a safer bet.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Great place if you want to grab a quick lunch for under $10! There's a great selection to choose from such as saba, shrimp tempura, beef teriyaki, etc. Definitely recommend the vegetable croquette. All meals come with rice and miso soup. 

Located in the East Mall so the atmosphere is much quieter and cozier.
author: Akina C.

description:
I didn't check Yelp (watashi baka ne Nobu-san) and we were in a hurry and this place seemed like the only one open around 3pm on a Tuesday so we walked in because I saw the sign for the lunch special... pick two sides/entrees and it comes with rice, miso soup and a pinch of garden salad for like $8.95... had to give it a whirl.  

Once we sat down I realized we were in a restaurant that was owned by a family that were not of Japanese decent which kind of bummed me out especially because A.) it is a Japanese restaurant and B.) we were in Japantown... we sucked it up and ordered... the gentleman who took our order (I'm guessing the owner) was very kind and welcoming and it looked like his daughter and wife were cooking/rolling sushi.  

I wouldn't recommend this place as a dining destination when visiting Japantown but our food wasn't bad.  Okay I wasn't fan of my Hamachi Steaks only because I could tell they were bought as frozen little filets and they were dry (decent texture near the skin where there was a little fat) but edible when I mixed the grated daikon (radish) with a little soy sauce and squeezed some fresh lemon juice (just made ponzu or citrus soy) and the tatsuage was ok although it lacked flavor...  maybe some fresh grated ginger and some grated garilc in the marinade would kick things up a bit (but then again it might come premade and frozen).  The Sanma wasn't very fishy which was nice and my friend ate it all up and the spicy tuna roll looked pretty to the eye but I saw them make it and the tuna came from a plastic bag which I've never seen before.  The miso soup was similar to most restaurants... simple with a piece of tofu and a couple slices of scallions and the salad was good but I only got a pinch (like 5 small pieces of lettuce)... it's cool I ate my friend's.  The rice was the highlight for me, super soft and moist and cooked near perfection which caught me off guard.

If you don't know much about Japanese food then you will love this place, if you know a little to a mediocre amount I wouldn't go unless everyone else around you was closed.  But honestly for less than $10 where else can you go to get a bento lunch these days?
author: Shiho F.

description: Great tasting and tender teriyaki beef! The servers were very polite and provided great service. I would come back again when I'm back in the area.
author: Joey C.

description: I really enjoyed my meal here!  The service was friendly and all the food was delicious.  The miso soup was tasty and not too salty like some other places.  The teriyaki chicken was very tender and tasty.  The vegetable tempura and shrimp tempura was light and fluffy without being overly breaded.  The salad was OK.  The California roll was also very fresh.  The curry rice was a little spicy but still good.  The salmon collar was also good.  The service was a little slow but it was worth it.
author: T. K.

description:
I always come here with my family and this place is never a let down. Everything here is exceptional, from the food to the presentation to the hospitality. The food is amazing; everything tastes exemplary. The mackerel is cooked to perfection, with a perfectly charred flavor that is served with daikon and a lemon slice on the side to complement the smoked taste. The tempura is beautifully crispy on the outside, but nice and fluffy on the inside. Both the shrimp and vegetable tempura are served fresh, as if they were just picked out of the garden or fished out of the sea. The gyoza, in my opinion, is their best work of art. Just one bite will bring an umami sensation to all your taste buds. Don't just take my word for it! Try it out for yourself!
The customer service here is impeccable. Each member here treats customers like family and gives you an "at home" feeling. They are very knowledgable about what they serve and will gladly recommend to you what specials there are that day. 
Additionally, the pricing here is great, considering the quality of the food. Japanese restaurants tend to be on the pricier side, but the costs here are very reasonable. You can get a whole meal with two special items for less than $10. There's also another option to get three special items that's relatively cheap as well. 

If you ever come to J-town in San Francisco, do make sure you come try out this place at least once!
author: Jammie Z.

description: Loved it! We came here looking for a good sushi roll and some miso soup. Very fresh and the fresh crab meat and fish eggs on top was delicious. It cost two of us less than $20 .
author: Jay B.

description: Nice place! Good deal for their special: choose 2 entree-type items with rice, salad & miso soup for only $8.99! We had saba, chicken katsu, avokyu roll, and teriyaki beef.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I give it 4 stars for such cheap pricing. Food was pretty okay/good. 

I got an eel roll - I've never had anything with unagi that isn't good and this place was no exception.

I also got the terriyaki salmon bento and it was pretty filling for just $8.50. The place is quite dim, small and the furniture has seen better days, but the place is decent enough.
author: Amy T.

description: Best kept secret at the mall beside Japantown Peace Plaza.  A humble restaurant serving authentic Japanese food at reasonable prices.
author: Liza Marie N.

description:
2.5 stars for us.

The food was ok, the prices were average, the service was ok.
We've been to a lot of Japanese restaurants and in comparison, there was nothing special about this place to us. We both ordered the bento special for $8.50 (the two item + miso soup + salad + rice one) and a dynamite roll. 

Johann: I ordered the fried oysters and tonkatsu. It was yummy and the portions were good. The salad was really small compared to other restaurants but I didn't mind. The dynamite roll was ok; it just tasted like a California roll with Sriracha in my opinion.  

Melvin: I ordered udon and tonkatsu. That's all I got. (+ salad which my girlfriend had to ask them to bring me, which they did hesitatingly)
  
*****BE CAREFUL WHEN ORDERING UDON WITH THE BENTO SPECIAL!!!
Apparently, since you ordered udon, you don't get rice. And, since udon is a soup, you don't get miso either. So much for advertising that all bento specials come with 2 choices+soup+rice+salad. As aforementioned, the only reason I got soup is because we pushed for it. Regardless, I was hoping for at least some rice with the tonkatsu. My girlfriend had to split her rice portion with me. Overall, the food was ok-- nothing special. 

Lastly, this restaurant doesn't validate. :(
author: Johann Christine A.

description:
Their lunch specials are pretty great in terms of price, taste, and serving size.

I usually get a spicy ramen and ton katsu combo and I always walk out full and satisfied. 

The owner also seems to be a nice and attentive guy. Try out the place if you get the chance.
author: Steven L.

description:
The bizarrely short chairs are puzzling (even for 5'2" me!) but the grilled fish is quite tasty. The serene surroundings appear as if they are rarely crowded making Kuishinbo a perfect choice for quiet conversation. 

Come here if you want to be left alone with your meal - not if you want to be chatted up by the waitstaff or "seen".
author: Miriam W.

description: Food was fantastic.  I really like their "special" board where you get to choose from 15+ items to pick 2 for a complete meal.  Great service, great food.  A tucked away gem in the center.
author: Nicole C.

description: Delicious food and tons of it in the $9.49 special. Definitely going to make this a regular place!
author: Emily L.

description: I love this place, their lunch menu you have a choice of two items for $8.99.  The two of us were out the door under $24.00 (that included a $4.00 tip)!  The food is very, very good, my tempura and soup delicious!
author: Jenette E.

description: there was a 20 minute wait which wasnt a problem but when we were seated they took our drink order and my sister asked for a green tea and a water, the waitress said were busy you have to chose one. ?? after that several different people proceeded to approach our table pressuring us to order 4 different times in a matter of 5 minutes asking us if we were ready to order. we were all panicking, scrambling, & we still were getting familiar with the menu, it was our first time at the restaurant. they seemed like they were trying to rush us out the door. it made me very uncomfortable. i ordered the sushi burrito and the fish didnt seem that fresh to me but the miso soup was very good. overall the portions for the food are very generous and the things my sister and fiancé ordered looked good. the restaurant in general didnt seem that clean. also we were never once offered refills for our drinks. I really dont like leaving bad reviews i feel bad but i hate receiving bad service and feeling uncomfortable when im paying for food!
author: Emilie D.

description: Yes, it's really good deal for $8.99. Very friendly staff, I speak English really bad and they were pretty patient to me.  I ordered avokyu roll and kaky fry and they weren't bad but I think it was too many bread in kaky fry.
author: Ksenia B.

description: Decent sushi for a great price.   The owner was very friendly.  I had the sampler and liked it all. My favorite was the salmon.
author: Gregg T.

description:
Food....  I guess it's supposed to be a Japanese restaurant, but just because it's in one of the main Japantown buildings doesn't mean it serves an authentic Japanese meal...  Nothing really special, doesn't even cook with Japanese rice...  I'm yet to find a good Japanese restaurant in SF though.

Unfortunately one start is for the service...  coming in, nobody was waiting so I had to ask the chef behind the counter to see I should just seat myself.  After finishing, I was sitting with my credit card waiting to be checked, but it took 10 minutes for a waiting staff to actually take care of me...  all the while s/he was busy cleaning up the mess of another table (no, the place wasn't even half full).

This place does not live up to the standard.  For the first time in a long time, I gave less than 10% tip.
author: T J.

description: This is not a place we would return to.  Those who had ordered teriyaki dishes said that the sauce had a very strange flavor.  The rice was old rice reconstituted by drenching it with water and microwaved.  It was soggy.  The miso soup was tasteless.  Don't try to fool the public with poor quality food.  We would prefer to pay more for good quality food.  We will definitely not go back.
author: Liz Q.

description: came here today for lunch with two other friends. Place was not packed, but yet our orders took so long. I would say a good 20-30 min wait for the food. We ordered: Dragon roll-the most decent dish out of the rest we ordered, the Curry rice & tonkatsu special-tonkatsu so dry, curry tasted like chinese curry, not japanese curry at all...not much curry taste, ordered veggie Udon- soup looked bland but actually taste decent,  last but not least the Sashimi combo- ordered Salmon & Hamachi. I would never come back here again. The sashimi cut was medicore- ic an even prob cut better then the chef!  Fish was NOT fresh at all!!!  yuck. But I gave two stars because of the customer service. They were nice and courteous...just the food is BAD!
author: Alyce l.

description:
Kuishinbo always serves ecclectic dishes for lunch and dinner, with fantastic fish options and side dishes that compliment well. The service is sometimes slow, sometimes slightly crabby, but the food is SO WORTH IT.  

It really is like eating at home in a Japanese kitchen from my experience.
author: Heather S.

description: I'm still loving this place.  They are always consistently good and the waiter/owner? is always very nice.  They work very hard and really appreciate your business.  Also they are right next to Ichi Ban Kan!
author: Michelle A.

description:
Good value for money. Great service.

Every time I always eat their 2-item bento set (comes with rice, miso soup, and nice little salad). The size is somewhat smaller than other restaurants in Japan town, but it's also cheaper. 

Usually I don't care much about a restaurant's service unless it's totally unacceptable. However, what makes me come back here is their great service. I think they're family: dad, mom and daughter. Dad is the server and he did great job. Always smiling and attentive. Super polite. His wife and daughter are also really nice to guests.

Their food is delicious, but not great. Good place to come for inexpensive & quick lunch or dinner.
author: Sue R.

description: I got the Salmon Teriyaki Bento Box Special and it was cheap and good. However, when I tried to order my first choice, Chicken Teriyaki Bento Box Special, the waiter kept trying to persuade me to go for the special on the white board. it was like he wanted to change the meal for me and i thought that was a bit strange for him to keep telling everyone when they ordered to get something else. Other than that, it was a good restaurant. It seated 9 of us
author: Kellie S.

description: For a $10 lunch with a 5 minute wait time, this is great. Four tasty kaki fry (fried oysters) with a ketchup type dipping sauce and a side of rice. That said, the teriyaki chicken was bland and rubbery. The lunch special also comes with some fantastic miso soup. Save that for last to finish right.
author: Kevin G.

description: Stopped in for some quick sushi today. There was 4 or 5 other tables that looked pretty happy. They have a deal going on for two items with rice and soup but all of the options are fried or tempura. Everyone who order the specially looked pleased. The waiter was attentive at first and brought out my seaweed salad which was pretty disgusting.  There was a fishy last to it and it seemed to have a funky smell like it has been sitting out. I then ordered their sushi plate. Overall this fish was fresh but the waiter left it sitting at the sushi bar for at least 10 minutes before bring it to me. I doubt I would ever go back and since there are so many options in Japan town there are much better restaurants just a few steps away.
author: Heather S.

description: One of the few places that's not give much of a chance because it's a hole in the wall on the edge of the japan town mall. Decent priced for a decent meal. You can't go wrong with any of their options. There's also a special where you pick 2 items for $8.95 which I think is awesome especially for Japanese anything. Recommend giving this place a try if you're ever in Japan town.
author: Dave N.

description:
We came here searching for a bento box dinner on the cheap, and bowed before the mighty dry erase board outside which prophesied the day's specials.

We ventured inside to find the place remote and largely vacant, as an over attentive waiter seated us. He felt unsure to ever leave us alone, as he kept coming back to stress the wonders of the day's specials... hardly ever giving us a moment to look over the menu ourselves. Thankfully we had already decided what we wanted before coming in, and so decided to stop toying with the menu and just order before the night drew any further.

We were satisfied with all of the food we subsequently got. The wood chopsticks were on the cheap side, but they did little to detract from the yummy food. Sadly, the place has a slightly crushing atmosphere. It is deathly quite inside, with no music or anything and no chatter to make the place more lively, and overall... one leaves the place feeling a little sorry for it. To the point where if we go back it would be because of that empathy feeling for them. Kind of odd... but true.

Anyway, overall it was good but not great. If we go back or not will probably depend on how much our heart strings are pulled upon (or if they have a new but cheap dry erase board special as we are walking by).
author: Sami R.

description:
Okay so I decided to come here again after my first visit back in early January. I loved their prices and quality of food. Their Volcano Roll is to die for, so make sure you get that! They also have some specials which are mix and match 2 for ONLY $7.50. I got the ramen with katsu and the volcano roll. My friends got the tiger roll and said that the volcano roll is much better. 

The reason why i'm rating this place 5 stars is because of the fact that you'd expect a lot of places to have really great tasting japanese food since you're in Japantown but you're wrong. This is as good as it gets.

We all tipped 25% because of the fact that we never had to ask for anything, the kind man always knew when we were running low on something. Make sure you get the chance to come here and save $$ and have some good food.
author: Diane K.

description:
San Francisco's  Japantown is one of the last three Japanese historical areas left in the United States..... I hope it survives! With this economy and far less Japanese immigrants I wonder. This place was ok, decent, not bad. It had a great lunch special... two items for $8.50 with soup, a small salad, and rice. The ambiance looks like the place was bought a long time ago, and they just "use the space" The sushi bar is unused and the place looked like it has seen a happier time. This mall is unfortunately going downhill, and I hope places like this will not disappear, but everyone needs to upgrade a bit to bring back "the good ole days" 
    We stopped for the lunch special and that was not bad. The food tasted good and it had that "mom homestyle cooking " taste to it. Probably because the wife was cooking inside! They did not seem Japanese, and they weren't since they did not respond to my friends questions. Anyway the food tasted ok and well... it is not bad. I think it would be much better with a little music, and some updated decor (or at least cared for)
author: Shane S.

description:
We spent yet another Saturday in Japantown, and decided to try yet another restaurant.  But according to my husband, this is the last one we will try, as this is the only place he ever wants to eat again.  The gyoza tasted Japanese, not Chinese, and he went absolutely crazy for the okonomiyaki.  He would not shut up about it.  My Ten Don was less wonderful--way more batter than necessary (and I never complain about fried dough).

Baby Bea loved it.  She ate so much rice and dried fish and okonomiyaki.  Our waiter was lovely and attentive, bringing over new chopsticks after she dropped the first set.  I guess we'll get to know him pretty well when we eat here twice a week from now on.

High chairs? Yes..
Changing tables?  Didn't check, but I suspect they don't even have their own bathroom.
Stroller-friendly?  Reasonably so.  It was mostly empty when we came, so no problem.
Noise level?  Dead quiet.  Not even any music.
General baby-friendliness?  Just fine.
author: Jennifer G.

description: Yum! Delicious, not expensive, great service, not too crowded, lovely atmosphere.
author: Andrew M.

description: I haven't tried their sushi, but this is my go-to place for delicious bento boxes! Thier agedashi tofu is THE BEST , and their other bento options are spot on.Two entree options, along with soup, tea, and salad side is less than $9. I give this place a 4.5. I usually round down, but I will make an exception for this one.
author: Dieter L.

description: Very good food for cheap. $8.50 for a filling and tasty lunch with two half entrees. the Takoyaki was pretty good, not amazing, but good.
author: Anu J.

description: I think this place is adorable. I love their udon and oftentimes will go with my boyfriend and share a special. Which for the both of us comes out to 8.50! Food is great and the price is right!
author: Alex D.

description:
Ha, this place is a secret! It's tucked away in the corner, literally.  I hate putting a review up but at the same time I need it to stay open.  I live in the neighborhood and I think I've tried almost every place in the mall and buchanan ally and this is where I go for a bento box. I would say if you are looking for good sushi this is not the place, but nor is most of japantown ironically.

Why 5 stars?  
- Tastes authentic, a place my japanese grandmother would go to frequently, and i do see older Japanese women going in for takeout. 
- Great and wide selection of choices for the bento box
- The price, you will NOT find a better deal in Japantown for the equivalent food
- The server (owner?) is the nicest guy and it's like walking into the smaller type restaurant in Japan
- No wait, I've never waited for table, though I've never gone during one of the many festivals in Japantown
- I dare say that this is the best tempura, for those who know their tempura

You get the point, great small neighborhood favorite unspoiled by mainstream foot traffic of the mall and pretentious yelpers like myself.
author: Tom Y.

description: My favorite Japanese restaurant in JapanTown!  I pretty much always get the 2 item special with Tonkatsu and Veggie Tempura, an awesome deal that I usually have to spend twice as much money at other restaurants to satisfy my craving for.  I've ordered some Sushi and Udon on a few occasions and was very happy with the quality of everything I've sampled so far.  Their beer and sake prices are pretty much the best in JapanTown now that Sanuki has raised the price of their sake happy hour, large hot sakes at Kuishinbo are just $3.50 all day long.  I try and visit this hidden gem as often as I can!
author: John H.

description: I love this little place. Just good and cheap food.  2 items for $8.50? And it's good...totally worthwhile. Try their grilled saba as one of the items.  You won't be disappointed! The owners are very sweet and always accommodating.
author: Cindy C.

description:
After trying to find a different restaurant, we stumbled upon this cute little restaurant that located inside the Plaza Mall in J-town on the second floor. 
From the moment we walked in we were warmly greeted and showen to our table. The chairs were on the smaller side (which was great for me being all of 5'1, not so great for the bf who had to suffer the whole time we were here teeheehee).  We were handed our menu's and told about their daily specials which were written on a white board at the front of the restaurant. With the speical, you get to choose two from the board and it comes with salad, rice and miso soup.  
Our waiter never came by to bother us with the old "are you ready to order". Instead he waited for us to look up and then he came over. In the beginning i wanted the teriyaki chicken and vegetable tempura entree. The waiter convinced me it would be alot cheaper to just order from the daily special menu which had both items that i wanted. Okay, so i gave in and ordered from the white board. The reason why i didnt order from the board the first time was because i didnt know how much it was since the price was not listed. Turned out after we got our bill that indeed it was much cheaper and you got alot more food in the long run for $8.95!!!

While waiting for our food to be served, i noticed just how quite this little place was. Sure, there were about 6 tables being occupied by various people but they all talked with a normal non loud tone which was nice to finally be able to hear and have a decent conversation. Well not saying i could never hear when i was at other places, but its nice not to have to raise your voice.Totally felt relaxed and kind of zen as well. 

The waiter brough out my meal first, served on a pretty tray there was a small plate of teriyaki chicken-(large cuts of chicken with teriyaki sauce and sesame seeds sprinkled on top), medium size plate of veggie tempura(-sweet potato,zucchini,carrot,broccoli), a small cup of miso soup-(small cubes of soft tofu, green onions),rice, and a garden salad with dressing.

The waiter came around often to make sure everything was okay and to refill our water glasses. 

Just the right amount of food, perfect in its simplicity!!
author: Sarah A.

description: great food. very affordable. they don't get enough credit on yelp. we loved it
author: Brian W.

description:
After almost a day of walking around Union Square, my husband and I decided to check out Japantown.  We had a very pleasant dinner at Kui Shin Bo.  I had the chasiu ramen and shrimp tempura and my husband the tonkatsu and tempura.  Both of our dinners were very tasty, my ramen had pieces of very tender pork and the soup was not over salted as some other ramen places make theirs.  The tempura was also very crispy.  My husband's tonkatsu was light and crunchy.  Tonkatsu is his favorite...
The waiter/owner? was very nice.  We would eat here again.
author: Peggy K.

description: Food was good, but the waiter was very rude arguing, forgetting items, and also forgot about the FOOD. Horrible service.
author: Rashad Y.

description:
I'll start with the positives: prices were decent and service was super attentive. Free ice cream came at the end of the meal, and miso soup and a few leaves of salad with thousand island dressing were included. Now here goes.

We wandered in here tired and hungry, lured in by the dry erase board detailing the day's specials. The waiter interrupted our menu browsing every 2 minutes to tell us something about the specials menu. 

We ordered the salmon nigiri, chicken teriyaki and oyako don. I took one bite of the nigiri into the still frozen center. 

Yes. The salmon was frozen. But it gets worse. Imagine our trepidation when we heard the beeping of a microwave timer going off followed by the sound of the door slamming shut. 

Our food came. The vegetables in the oyakodon were wilted and sad, the rice drowning in sauce or water. I couldn't eat more than a few bites. The free ice cream was free, but freezer burned.

Why, oh why did we come here in an oasis of good food?! Don't make the mistake we made, and stay away.

Bottom line: FROZEN SASHIMI. SERIOUSLY.
author: Lily H.

description: Best deal in Japantown. It's $7.50 for a 2 item bento box dinner -- big portions. The katsu chicken and california roll were both respectable. The owners (from Burma) are super nice and generous. They even threw in free ice cream. They used to serve Burmese, but now stick to Japanese.
author: Andrew K.

description: Such a sweet, intimate restaurant with a dear, kind man who delivers quality food. I had the lunch special, which was delish and well-priced, and a nice combo of miso, salad and a wide variety if options. I love that it's in the mall, just steps from Kabuki hotel.
author: Samantha S.

description:
I've had dinner here twice, and it's a relatively quiet restaurant, so I find it nice to have conversations here with friends over dinner and get some space. 

The service is really friendly and attentive. The server I've had the past 2 times seems to really care about the patrons' needs.
